전에는 무료였는데 지금은 티켓을 끈지않음 결재판같은걸 들은 여직원이 빽빽~하면서 돌아가라고 외친다. 탑은...신기했다 ㅎㅎ 함쯤 올라갈만하다
하노이에 남아 있는 탕롱 황성의 일부분인 역사 유적으로 내부는 크게 볼 것은 없습니다. 계단 통해서 들어갈 수 있으며, 탑 꼭대기까지 갈 수 없게 되어 있어 탑의 중간 부분까지만 올라갈 수 있습니다.

data.formatted_address: 4 P. Hàng Chiếu, Đồng Xuân, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, 베트남
data.name: Ô Quan Chưởng

reviews.text: 저녁 야식 사러가는길에 우연히 찾음 ㅋ
멋있고 일상 생활속 모습들이 좋았어요
낡은 성벽입니다

하노이의 아름답고 고대 유적지. 작은 거리, 수백 년 된 플라타너스 나무가 있는 고대 문이 이곳을 더욱 신비롭고 성스럽게 만듭니다. O Quan Chuong이라는 이름은 Tu Duc 26년에 프랑스 식민주의자들이 하노이 성채를 공격했을 때(1873년 11월 20일) 발생한 사건에서 유래되었으며, 총리와 100명의 군인이 마지막까지 이 성채를 지켰습니다. 그러므로 사람들은 그 공덕을 기념하기 위해 이 문을 오관충(O Quan Chuong)이라고 부릅니다.

O Dong Ha라고도 알려진 O Quan Chuong은 Le Hien Tong 왕의 통치 기간(1749)에 지어졌으며 Thang Long 성채 동쪽에 위치하고 있으며 옛 Red River 부두에서 약 80m 떨어져 있어 교통이 편리합니다. 관광객은 수도 이외의 지역에서 여행하고 무역합니다. O Quan Chuong이라는 이름은 2019년 11월 20일 동하문을 통해 하노이를 공격한 프랑스군에 맞서 100명의 응우옌 왕조 군인들과 함께 끝까지 싸우겠다는 각오를 다진 총리의 숭고한 공로와 희생을 기념하기 위한 것입니다.

오늘날까지도 O Quan Chuong은 원래의 건축물을 그대로 유지하고 있습니다. 이 출입구는 당시 응우옌 왕조의 전형적인 건축 양식에 따라 설계되었습니다. 중앙에 정문이 있고 양쪽에 2개의 옆문이 있는 정자 스타일입니다. 대문 높이는 3m이고 곡선형 지붕이 있는 정자는 2층에 난간으로 둘러싸여 있습니다. 정문 왼쪽 벽에는 1881년 호앙 디에우(Hoang Dieu) 주지사가 명령한 문지기가 지나갈 때 사람들을 괴롭히는 것을 금지하라는 명령이 적힌 돌비석이 있습니다. 정문 상단과 전망대 하단 사이 세 개의 큰 한자 동하몬(Dong Ha Mon)이 새겨져 있다.

data.formatted_address: Hùng Vương, Điện Biên, Ba Đình, Hà Nội 11812 베트남
data.name: 바딘 광장

reviews.text:
2023.3.30방문
세미패키지 프로그램중 한곳
호치민의 묻혀 있는곳
베트남 학생들에 교육장으로도 많이 사용되는곳
광장히 굉장히 넓어요
짧은하의나 민소매는 철저히 관리하여
입장을 못하게한다
광장 좌우로 입장가능하고 검문소가 있어서 짐검사 해야합니다
호치민 묘소와 베트남 국회의사당 사이에 있는 넓은 광장입니다. 꽤 넓고 깨끗합니다. 그리고 국가적인 장소가 근처에 있다 보니 베트남 공안들의 경비가 삼엄한 편입니다. 방문시 실수로 제한구역에 들어가지 않도록 주의하세요.
출입구 찾는것도 힘들고 너무 넓어서 걸어서 구경하기엔 무리가 있다. 출입하는것도 까다롭고.이곳에 패키지로 묶여있는 다른 관광명소라는 곳이 있기에 어쩔수 없이 입장하는데 별로 그닥..2번째 방문이지만 다음에는 정말 않온다고 다짐한다.

아주 넓은 광장.
제한구역 라인이 있으니 주의하시고 둘러보시면 됩니다.
입구에는 소지품 검색대가 있습니다. 라이타 소지 안됩니다.

data.name: 따히엔 맥주거리

reviews.text: 혼잡하고 정신이 없습니다. 다는 안그러겠지만 여차하면 눈탱이 씨게 맞습니다. 생맥주 3잔에 오징어 안주 하나로 해산물 저녁식사 가격보다 2배 지불했네요...맥주거리 시작 전에 있는 가게들이 조용하고 저렴합니다. 분위기는 충분히 좋구요~!
다시 지나가는게 민망할정도로 호객행위가 심함. 세네바퀴돌다 겨우겨우 입구쪽가게 하나골라 앉음. but 분위기는 말할필요없이 젊은거리임. 가능하다면 메뉴는 대략 고르고 가시는게 시간절약에 도움될 듯.

활기차네요
호객행위가 많긴하지만 관광지느낌이 물씬풍기네요
사람구경하는 재미가 있어요.

2023년 2월 일요일 저녁에 저녁식사 후에 하노이 맥주거리 방문했구요.
와~ 사람이 진짜 많았습니다.
사람 많은 곳에 테이블 하나 있어서  간단한 안주 한개와 맥주, 음료 마셨습니다.
중학교 1학년 아들 포함 저희 가족 3명이서 먹었는데요.
테이블 간격이 매우 좁고, 담배 피우는 사람들이 많아서 오래 앉아있기는 힘들었어요.
30분정도 있다가 빠져나왔습니다.
근데 분위기는 참 좋아요. 하노이 처음이면 한번쯤은 방문해볼만 합니다.
음식, 술은 비싸고 맛있지 않으니 아주 간단한거만 주문해서 경험해보는게 좋겠습니다.
식사는 여기서 하지말고 다른 곳에서 하는것을 추천합니다.
구시가 중심에 저녁에 펼쳐지는 음식거리~ 여행마친 여행자들과 현지인들이 뒤섞여 하루를 시원한 맥주 한잔으로 마무리 짓는곳...북적거리는 인파속에 흥겨운 음악소리 재밌고 즐겁습니다~ 호객은 많으나 본인 원하는 곳으로 가시면 되요~

data.formatted_address: Đ. Bưởi, Thủ Lệ, Ba Đình, Hà Nội 100000 베트남
data.name: 투레공원

reviews.text:
롯데마트에서 식사를 하고, 소화도 시킬 겸 들렀습니다.
일단 구경하고 있는 사람들이 아주 많았어요.

동물원이 대부분을 차지했는데,
생각보다 정말 많은 동물들이 있었습니다.

그런데 동물원을 너무 오랜만에 와서 그런지
너무 당황스러운 일들이 많았습니다.

동물들은 관리가 제대로 안 되고 있었고,
쥐가 앵무새 밥을 훔쳐먹고 있었습니다.

그리고 타조 우리 옆은 배드민턴 코트였는데
배드민턴을 치던 아이들이 셔틀콕을 실수로 타조우리로 떨어뜨렸습니다.
그리고 타조는 그 셔틀콕을 먹었습니다…

입장료는 1인 4만동으로 저렴한 편이었습니다.
동물들 관리에 조금 더 신경썼으면 좋겠네요.
무더운날씨 공원을 방문했습니다. 공원은 생각보다 너무 크고 날이 더운탓에 한바퀴를 다 돌지 못하고 나왔지만, 사자,호랑이, 다양한 동물들 그리고 코끼리 즐길거리가 많았습니다.
롯데마트 가다가 들렸어요. 동물들 관리를 잘 안해주는 느낌이에요.. 아파보여요.. 생쥐도 너무 많고.. 입장료는 2천원정도라 저렴합니다. 동물원 오시는거면 비추..
주변 호수의 물 비린내가 너무 심합니다. 멀리서보면 고즈넉하고 괜찮은데 가까이가면 냄새 때문에 찡그리게 됩니다. 정비가 좀 필요할 것 같아요.
굳이 찾아서 간건 아니고 근처에 마트 가려다 공원 있길래 들림. 생각보다 동물종류가 많았고 특히 원숭이종류가 되게 많았음 근처 볼일 있으면 한번쯤은 가 볼만 함. 귀신의집도 들어가봤는데 은근 무서웠음 .. 월요일에 가서그런지 방문객은 별로 없었고 간간히 아이들 데리고 나온 부모님 몇몇만 볼수 있었음

data.formatted_address: 1 Tràng Tiền, Phan Chu Trinh, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, 베트남
data.name: 하노이 오페라 하우스

reviews.text: 공연과 내부 공간이 좋았습니다. 역사를 자랑하는 오페라하우스에서 국립 발레 공연을 볼 수 있어서 유익한 곳이었습니다.

하노이의 대표적인 관광지입니다. 낮보다 조명이 켜진 밤이 더 멋진 곳이에요.
보통은 외관만 찍지만 전 공연을 봐서 안에 들어갈 수 있었어요.
유럽 풍의 인테리어입니다. 상당히 고풍스러워요. 생각보다 낡아서 조금 놀랐지만 나름 분위기가 있어요.
공연장은 크제 않습니다. 오패라 하우스 특유의 층고가 높아요. 그래서 2,3층의 객석도 꽤 높아요. 3층에서 내려다보면 후덜덜 할 수 있을 것 같아요. 실제로 무서웠다는 얘기를 들었어요.
전 2층에서 공연을 봤는데 연주자의 표정까지 잘 보였어요. 소리 울림도 괜찮았어요.
2층 여자 화장실의 자물쇠가 고장나서 안 잠겼어요. 고쳤는지 모르겠네요.
대규모 오케스트라 공연을 하기에는 협소해 보입이다. 하지만 실내악이나 솔로 콘서트에는 괜찮을 것 같아요.
한번쯤 공연을 보시기를 추천합니다. 색다른 느낌이에요. :)
사진에 진심인 베트남 사람들과 세계각지의 젊은이들이 찾는 여행자거리의 핵심루트

시티투어 버스탈려고 가다렸습니다만,
서양풍의 건물.. 하노이 오페라하우스 였네요.
앞에서 사진남기기 좋습니다.
안에 들어가보진 않았습니다.

카페도 옆에 있어서 좋고, 사진찍기 딱 좋은 곳!

주변에 맛집, 째즈바 등도 있고 걸어서 짱티엔 플라자를 거쳐 호안끼엠에 갈 수 있음.

오페라 하우스 옆에  호안끼엠을 지나고 서호까지 돌아오는 2층 버스 타는 곳이라 시간되는 관광객들은 2층 버스 타는 것도 추천함!

성인 15만동 원웨이 돌아오는 티켓 가격임.
6세 이하 아동은 10만동인가 내야 하는걸로  정도 변경되었다고 안내원이 카드기 보여주며 말하였지만 내가 영어로 계속 말해서 그런지 그냥 태워줌 ... 2층 버스 안에 한국어 가이드 이어폰 있으니 꼭 들으면서 가세요~

data.formatted_address: 3 P. Trần Phú, Hàng Bông, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội 100000 베트남
data.name: 하노이 기찻길

reviews.text: 가짜 공안이 입구에서 커피 안사면 절대 못 들어가게 합니다. 눈도못쳐다보는 주제에 무시하고 들어가려했더니 호루라기를 귀청 떨어지게 불어버려서 귀에서 피날뻔했습니다. 영어도 못해서 말도 안통해요. 들어가려는 관광객들(저 포함) 팔 잡아끌면서 내쫒네요. 여자남자 안가립니다. 절대 커피 사지 말고 반대편입구로 들어가세요. 옆길로 걸어서 5분도 안걸립니다. 근데 여기보다는 더 남쪽에 영어로 Train street coffee 치면 나오는곳으로 가세요. 사람도 적고 상인들도 훨씬 친절합니다. 밤에 기차가 더 많이다녀요 밤에가는거 추천드려요.

어떤 유튜버는 기차를 한번도 못 보고 아쉬운 발걸음 했는데 우리는 운 좋게 3번이나 기차를 봤다.
혼자서는 못들어가고 호객하는 분 따라서 들어가면 된다.
2층이 좋다고 하는 사람도 있지만 내 개인적인 경험으론 1층에서 보는게 가장 생생하다.정말 코앞에서 기차가 지나가기 때문에 사진 영상 찍을때 조심해야한다.
정말 낭만적이고, 예뻤어요!  맥주나 커피 가격도 다른 곳에 비해 비싸지않고, 호객 하는 분들 있는데 그냥 따라가면 신경써서 잘해주더라구요. 위치도 가격도 모두 만족스러웠어요. 꼭 가볼만한 곳이에요~
한번쯤은 올만한 곳, 카페가 많아 이색적이다. 단, 기차를 만나기는 어렵다. 일부 구간만 들어올 수 있고 나머지는 경찰이 막고 있다.

가짜 공안이 거드름 피우며 입구에서 커피 강매한다고 유명한 하노이 기찻길. 절대 돈 뜯기지 마시고, 그냥 들어가시면 됩니다. (벌금 표지판도 무시하세요.)
근데 요즘은 소위 말하는 짭 공안이 적극적으로 카페 호객하는 행위도 심하지 않더군요. (24년 3월 기준) 그 많은 관광객을 다 잡을 수는 없겠죠.
사진과 같이 정말 예쁘고, 도대체 진짜 사용하는 기찻길이 맞나 싶을 정도로 길 사이 건물과 길이 가까이 위치해있습니다.
서양인들이 이렇게 카메라를 많이 들고 포즈 잡고 사진을 찍는 장소는 흔치 않은 것 같은데, 다들 사진 찍기 바쁘더군요.
그만큼 외국인들에게는 낯설고 예쁜 길입니다.
다시 온다면 기차 시간에 맞춰서 한 번 오고 싶네요.

data.formatted_address: 1 Hùng Vương, Điện Biên, Ba Đình, Hà Nội, 베트남
data.name: 호찌민 묘소

reviews.text:
호찌민 묘소
[Lăng Chủ tịch Hồ Chí Minh]

호찌민의 시신이 안치된
곳으로 베트남에서는 호찌민을
기리고 있다.

묘소 주변에는 베트남 주석궁과
호찌민 관저가 있고 묘소 앞에는
바딘광장이 있다.

입장할 때는 물품 검사가 있고
라이터는 반입이 안된다.
나가는 곳은 반대 쪽인데
라이터를 다시 가지러 가려면
3km 이상 걸어야 한다.

1년에 몇 번 호찌민의 시신을
볼 수 있는 날이 있다고 하니
그 날짜를 알아두고 방문하면
내부까지 들어갈 수 있다.
넓고 좋지만 그늘이 많이 없어서 힘들었어요. 더운 날씨에는 코스를 변경하는게 좋을 거 같아요. 호찌민 수석님이 지내신 작은 공간에서 이 엄청난 혁명을 이끌어낸 것이 정말 대단합니다.

평일 오전 10시 30분에 갔는데 들어갈 수 있었어요.
입구는 여기 아니예요! 호치민 박물관 쪽 입장하는 곳으로 가야하고 소지품 검사 합니다.
카메라, 물 등은 통과가 안됩니다.
줄서서 입장하는데 조금 기다릴 수 있어요
호치민 묘소는 경비가 많았어요
더 머무를 수도 없이 후다닥 지나쳐서 보게 하더라고요
호치민 미라가 있는 곳이었는데 뭔가 느낌이 이상했어요
진짜인가 가짜인가 열띤 토론을 했죠;;
호치민 묘소를 나오면 주변은 자유롭게 관람 할 수 있었어요
아침 일찍 방문하는것이 돌아다니기 좋아요!
하노이에서 처음으로 걷기 좋다! 라는 말을 한 곳😭

베트남인이 제일 존경하는 인물인 호치민의 묘소입니다. 이렇게 설명하면 마치 박물관이나 체험학습같은 느낌이 드실 수 있겠지만, 관광객 입정에서는 사진 찍기 좋고 산챡하기 좋은 곳으로 생각하시면 좋을 것 같습니다.

개인적으로 하노이에서 제일 기분좋게 산책한 곳 같습니다. 베트남 군인들이 근무 교대하는 모습도 봤는데... 생각보다 프리한 느낌이라 깜짝 놀랐습니다. 그리고 전에 다낭에 놀러갔을 때도 호치민이라는 인물이 어떤 인물인가 관심이 있었는데, 많은 정보도 얻고 흥미로운 경험이었습니다.

단, 호치민 묘소 인근에서 택시 호객하는 분들은 정말 악질이니 주의하시기 바랍니다(그랩 못잡아서 탔다가 2km 가고 100만동 달라는 모습보고.... 다행히(?) 안 되는 영어로 화내고 했더니 잘 해결(?) 됬습니다)
입장료는 무료 입니다. 일요일 오전에 가서 줄이 엄청 길었는데 직원이 5분 정도 소요 된다고 해서 기다렸어요. 엄청 긴 줄에 비해 기다리는데는 생각보다 오래 걸리진 않아요. 다만 입출입구가 엄청 제한되어 있어서 잘 찾아가야 해요.

data.formatted_address: 2RPM+8CX, P. Chùa Một Cột, Đội Cấn, Ba Đình, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: One Pillar Pagoda

reviews.text: The One Pillar Pagoda in Hanoi is a must-visit for anyone exploring the city's cultural gems. Its lotus-inspired design and rich history make it a captivating sight. While it may be small, you can step inside to offer a prayer and soak in the tranquil ambiance. Just be prepared for crowds of tourists eager to experience its beauty firsthand. Despite the crowds, the pagoda's spiritual aura and serene surroundings offer a peaceful escape from the bustling city streets.

One Pillar Pagoda is the king of Vietnam built back in the 10th century to thank the Buddha gave him a son. It became a famous temple for Vietnamese people who wanted to have a son. They will come here to pray to the Buddha and hope they’ll get a son next year. The temple is clean, and it is easy to go up the stairs. People are very orderly, following each other. This is a nice place to visit.

It's ok, at best. This very small building is a reconstruction of the original, and is besieged by tourists both foreign and domestic. One must also add that the pond that it's located in is quite filthy.
The extremely hot weather made it difficult for me to fully enjoy the place. However, the interior of the pagoda was truly remarkable.

must visited place in Hanoi.. the story behind this is also nice.. you must hear from the local guide while visiting this place.. this place is mostly crowed but you can easily visit pagoda after few mins of waiting.. i suggest if you are visiting Hanoi must visit this place as well... the surrendering is also decorated with bonsai trees ...

reviews.text: I loved how this place is intended for weekend gatherings with locals and tourists. Everyone is enjoying the street without cars for they will be able to use it for fun and activities such as dancing, games, or for the kids to play. It's so nice that they able to maintain their traditional bonding activities.

What a lively place this is. Especially after the evening.  The whole square gets filled up by the locals, the tourists, the vendors.. and there are a lot of people playing music, dancing on the beat, some of them just enjoying the vibe.

If you are done with all your sight seeing, do come to this square, sit and just observe the hustle of Hanoi amongst the endless crowd there.
Great place to drink coffee and watch how they can manage the flow of all transportation machines and pedestrians. No cop or anybody needed to organize this intersection.

Busy square at the tip of the city lake, and one edge of the Old Town area. Here you will find plenty of rickshaw drivers waiting for you, a wonderful island temples / Pagoda, a nearby I ♥️ Hanoi sign, and all the other things that abound in an old quarter.

One of the beautiful places in Hanoi. People gathers and enjoy beautiful Hoan Kiem lake view and city view together. Lots of shops are available here. Restaurants are offering different cuisines. Night Market is also available on weekend. Vehicle movements are restricted on night for public gathering.

data.formatted_address: P. Hàng Ngang, Hàng Đào, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Hanoi Old Quarter

reviews.text: An area in Hanoi, Vietnam is called the Old Quarter.  The area is very beautiful.  Every day tourists from different parts of the world come here to visit.  I visited here myself.  The security situation is very good.  The city is well organized.  The market condition here is also good.  Shopping can be done for very little money.  Food shops of different countries are here.  People's behavior is also sincere.  I can recommend everyone to visit here.

This is probably one of my favorite locations around Hanoi as you get a real feel for the hustle and bustle of the city from within the Old Quarter.  You get to see every age of Vietnamese at work and play and feel the real vibe of a busy city.  The old quarter takes you back in time to how life was, and still is, for many with shoppers and traders and eaters all competing for tiny spaces on streets.  Within this you also get to visit Train Street to see one of the most iconic and memorable views of the middle of Hanoi - by far this was my favorite afternoon to sit and watch the train go by within mm of your nose!!  A beautiful city full of hard working, wonderful people who live life on a dime but do it with a big smile, welcome and engaging personality that makes you feel both welcome and respected!! I love Hanoi!

American citizen here @visual_perspectivist

The only place I choose to stay in Hanoi! Find many affordable hostels or hotels and everything is walking distance!

Get out and explore, no need for taxi, your two feet will do!

Hanoi Old Quarter is the heart of the city which Is a very happening area and where you can find several eateries, many famous cafes etc.
I enjoyed the vibes of the Hanoi City, especially in this area. Had a wonderful food and shopping experience here and the best part is that the people are very kind, friendly and welcoming even though there was a language barrier.
Vibrant part of Hanoi where you can shop, eat, drink or get a massage. Good night life with a lot of bars and cafes. Cheap shopping. Best place to try the local food and drinks.

data.formatted_address: 1 Đ. Hoàng Hoa Thám, Đội Cấn, Ba Đình, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Ho Chi Minh’s Stilt House

reviews.text: I am happy to have a chance to see Ho Chi Minh’s Stilt House up close. I don't know when we will not be able to get any closer to the house anymore like most of the other historical buildings in the world. This is a wood construction, and the type of wood will last more than a thousand years, based on the tour guide.

Visiting Ho Chi Minh's Stilt House was a humbling experience. As I walked through the modest wooden dwelling, I couldn't help but feel a sense of reverence for the man who lived so simply despite his monumental role in Vietnam's history. The preserved artifacts and personal belongings offered glimpses into his daily life and unwavering dedication to his country. Standing in the tranquil garden surrounding the house, I reflected on the profound legacy of Ho Chi Minh and his enduring influence on Vietnam. It was a poignant reminder of the power of humility and commitment in shaping the course of history.

Growing up I heard so much about Ho Chi Minh so it was rather special to visit this incredibly humble house. It says a lot about the man. The house is a simple wooden stilt house, reflecting Ho Chi Minh's modest lifestyle. It has been preserved as a museum, allowing visitors to see the living quarters and personal belongings of Ho Chi Minh. The Stilt House is surrounded by beautiful gardens and is part of the larger Presidential Palace complex, which includes other historical buildings and structures.

Ho Chi Minh’s Stilt House offers a fascinating glimpse into the personal life of the revered leader during his lifetime. Situated within a tranquil setting, this humble abode showcases the living quarters and surroundings where Ho Chi Minh resided. Through meticulously curated exhibitions, visitors are treated to a comprehensive portrayal of his daily life, from the simple meeting rooms to his accommodations.

While the exhibits may seem modest, they serve as poignant reminders of the late president's enduring legacy and the significant role he played in shaping Vietnam's history. Exploring Ho Chi Minh’s Stilt House provides a unique opportunity to connect with the memories of this influential figure and gain insights into his profound impact on the nation.
Uncle Ho’s stilt house, located in Hanoi, is the place where Ho Chi Minh lived and worked during most of his time as leader of North Vietnam, from December 19, 1954 to September 2, 1969.

data.formatted_address: 87 P. Mã Mây, Hàng Buồm, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Heritage House

reviews.text: This place is such a gem in Hanoi. Taking a glimpse at how rich Vietnamese family lived back in the past was a great experience. Volunteers take visitors on a tour of the house and their explanation was informative. Would like to go to this house again for a cup of tea.

The house is worth a visit, but YOU DO NOT NEED A GUIDE! THEY ARE THE STAFF OF LOTUS TEA SHOP DOWNSTAIRS.  it was a complete waste of time. and one of they told us it's allowed to sit on the chair to take pictures. BUT then a female manager warned us to stay away from the furniture. an unpleasant experience !

We visited with a local guide; I can truly recommend a visit. You spend less than 30 minutes, and it gives you a good insight into how people used to live in the past. Also, interesting to learn about traditions and beliefs.

Admission 10,000 VND
Be aware they close 12-1:30 pm for lunch.

You don’t need a guide… it takes you 10 minutes to walk through the whole thing, plus there are some signs on the wall that you can read. Overall it is interesting but is very very small.

10k entry. I thought it was definitely worth a visit for 15-20 minutes, even without a tour guide. There are some explanations in English and it was interesting to see a traditional house from the late 1800s and imagine how people used to live.

data.formatted_address: 19c Hoàng Diệu, Điện Biên, Ba Đình, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Imperial Citadel of Thang Long

reviews.text: Nice historical place. Not a lot of clear explanations, but artifacts found in the ground are shown in a tiny museum with air conditioning. Emphasis of tiny. The best part are the views from the tower. You can see almost everything in 10 or 15 minutes.

An absolute must visit in Hanoi. Beautiful architecture and gardens.

Great history of Vietnam and the various dynasties.

If you're planning to walk make sure you go to the west side were the entrance is, we had to walk around the whole complex before finding the entrance.

Must buy tickets and only card accepted.

Beautiful views and photo opportunities.
Might be worthwhile to get an umbrella on hot sunny day.

To be very honest I didn't understand this place for which I paid 70k VND, I mean seriously. Either you need a guide to understand this place or there might be nothing great to understand or see.
The only thing I enjoyed was the gate where there were so many flowers and it was utterly beautiful but I mean paying so much money just to see that is not worth it at all.
If you are planning to visit this place then have your research ready before you visit.
There was no signage of the exit and I ended up waiting half an hour to find that, nobody understood English there and when I was trying to make them understand while using the translator it was difficult.

We went for the night tour. 90 minutes long, 300k vnd. A couple of historical reenactments which had all the entertainment value of an elementary school drama production.
The tour rushed through some of the museum type exhibit areas which meant time to read about the displays was cut short.
Oddly the tour abruptly ended about a 1/2 kilometre away from the starting point and outside of the citadel grounds. Which meant one needs to find their own way back to the entrance and parking area along a busy street with terrible footpaths. If you aren't familiar with the area this would be quite disconcerting.
Frankly, if one is set on visiting here, do it in the daytime and not with a tour.
The grounds are pleasant and the citadel is moderately interesting. But be clear, it's not particularly significant historically; the highlights appeared to be ground water wells that were a few hundred years old. Angkor Wat, it's not.

Nice place to learn about the history of Vietnam. But I would recommend going here armed with an umbrella and portable fan. It's open air so there's the tendency for the place to be hot to walk around.

reviews.text: The best town I had been reached once a life And you can taste beer and some local food with cheapest price hostels around here.can see cute vietnamese

A real must on a visit to Hanoi, and probably the place to base yourself.  Plenty of excellent boutique hotels to choose from (we are at the Shining Central) to fit any budget.  Lots to do and see from Train Street, which was excellent, to the hop on/off bus.  Went to the street market that on over the weekend, great.  The shops, food and people are perfect and the transport is buttons.  Not like any other city I've visited and it's a definate recommendation.

Had a great moment visiting in Old Quarter,
Tips: Pho is really good(Must try)
Night out moments so fascinating!!!!

Beer Street in Hanoi is a bustling, narrow alley lined with vibrant bars and eateries, where locals and tourists gather to enjoy a variety of beers and delicious street food. The atmosphere is lively and energetic, with colorful lights and the aroma of grilled food filling the air. It's a popular spot for socializing, sampling local brews like Bia Hoi (fresh beer), and experiencing Hanoi's vibrant nightlife.
This area is the perfect place to ve when exploring the streets of Vietnam. It has everything you need!

data.formatted_address: 48 P. Hàng Ngang, Hàng Đào, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: The Memorial House of Ho Chi Minh

reviews.text: Art Deco building where Ho Chi Minh wrote Vietnam's declaration of independence in 1945, so an important place in the country's history. The museum was well maintained and the staff friendly.

We are glad to pay a visit here to understand some of the historical story. Could be better as overall was a bit empty, not much you could see except ground and 1st floor. The house was huge compare to the serounding. Entrance was free.

Truly, a historic gem. Authentic furniture used by Ho Chi Minh including the table which he wrote the Vietnamese Declaration of Independence on are on display. Art Deco fans will enjoy the building. A great place to get away from the intense street crowds outside of the building. No admission fee. Highly recommend!
I really think this is an important piece of history. It won't take more than 20min, but well worth it.
What a privilege to have stumbled upon this  piece of history around Ho Chi Minh and the founding of modern State of Vietnam. A history of an epic struggle for Freedom.

data.formatted_address: 4 4 P. Ngọc Hà, Ngọc Hồ, Ba Đình, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Hồ hữu tiệp

reviews.text: On the night of December 27th 1972, during the Hanoi dien bien phu air campaign. A B-52 bomber was shot down and still remains in the lake. It is seen as a symbol of victory for the Vietnamese.

A peaceful and refreshing little place amidst the bustle of the city, B-52 Lake Hanoi stands as a historical landmark and a symbol of the resilience and endurance of the Vietnamese people during the war. Whether you're interested in the history of the conflict or would like to take different kinds of pictures during an urbex trip, this is definitely a must-go.
A piece of a B52 in the water in the middle of a residential neighborhood. There are small shops and what seems to be a raw meat/fish market nearby.
The site where a section of a b52 landed

Historic site with wreckage of B52 bomber. Locals who witnessed the shooting down of the plane say that the whole lake area was covered in plumes of smoke that the sun was not visible for few hours afterwards.

data.formatted_address: 59 P. Đinh Tiên Hoàng, Hàng Trống, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: The Pen Tower

reviews.text: Located in Hoan Kiem Lake.

Thap But - Pen Tower is located next to Hoan Kiem Lake, where you can get the ticket to visit Ngoc Son Temple. In 1865, scholar Nguyen Van Sieu repaired the temple to its present appearance, including The Huc Bridge and the Pen Tower, which has a diameter of 12m and is 4m high. The square tower has five floors. In the body of the tower, Nguyen Sieu carved the three words "Ta Thien Thanh", meaning "Writing to the blue sky". People often come here to pray, and the surrounding area has lots of trees, making it a great place to walk around in Hanoi.
Much activities around the lake are here. Weekend, car free day sees more activities in this area.
You can see it while walking around Hoan Kiem Lake.
A nice place to visit. It is chill and quiet at night.

reviews.text:
In the evening, this street becomes more moody place.
In front of the temple' gate, music group is playing nostargic music using local instrumentals.
On the street,  lamps are hung down from the tree.

Very cozy and fantastic place: )
Small but beautiful old temple in the old town. Just be aware of opening times, like many places it's closed for 1.5 hours for lunch between 12 noon and 1.30 pm. The place is free to visit.
Loved the ambience and very peaceful
This is a small but lovely temple in Hanoi's Old Quarter, dedicated to silver making. Worth stopping by for a peaceful moment, if you are in the area.
They usually hold exhibition here and sing vietnam traditional music (trù or quan họ...) in front of the pagoda during the weekend night

data.formatted_address: P. Đinh Tiên Hoàng, Tràng Tiền, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Ly Thai To Garden

reviews.text:
As I entered Ly Thai To Garden, the serene beauty of the landscaped greenery immediately captivated me. Located in the heart of Hanoi, this tranquil oasis provided a welcome escape from the city's hustle and bustle.

Strolling along the winding pathways, I marveled at the meticulously manicured gardens and vibrant flowers in bloom. The sound of trickling water from ornate fountains added to the peaceful ambiance, creating a perfect setting for relaxation and reflection.

Finding a quiet bench, I sat down to soak in the surroundings. Watching locals and tourists alike enjoying leisurely walks and picnics, I couldn't help but feel a sense of connection to the community and the rich history of the area.

As the sun began to set, casting a warm glow over the garden, I felt a profound sense of gratitude for the opportunity to experience such natural beauty in the heart of the bustling city. Ly Thai To Garden had provided me with a moment of tranquility and rejuvenation that I would carry with me long after leaving its peaceful embrace.
Nice walk, bits of history, bonsais and Hanoi street life at it best!

This park around the lake is really a peaceful area in Hanoi, very beautiful place for evening or morning walking. in the weekend all sq and streets around were close to the traffic and it was open just for pedestrians. in each corner a group of people were dancing, singing, doing acrobatic things etc. i saw a real happiness there and really enjoyed the weekend in Hanoi style.

it's in central Hanoi..very beautiful place. people come here more in the evening and spend till midnight. i saw many children are playing here. they are skating, cycling and other activities. there's a big road lakeside which is good for evening walk. people will obviously love that place. when go in the evening i saw many activities. there's a group of rap singer enjoying themselves.  i saw children riding cars, skating. must visit place of you go to hanoi.
Very nice in Vinh to enjoy a big space, rest and look at all the people and childen and their activities. Also to see the big statue of Ho Chi Mingh.

data.formatted_address: Km5+200, Đ. Lê Trọng Tấn, An Khánh, Hoài Đức, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Công Viên Thiên Đường Bảo Sơn

reviews.text:
It feels very run down and poorly maintained.  Glass walls where animals are kept are really dirty.

Still worth a visit if you have nowhere else to go. Highlights are VR area (extra 50k), feed the elephant and giraffe.

Staff are friendly. The entry fee is a bit on the high side.

No English maps available, hardly very few foreigners, very difficult to go around the part not knowing what all rides were there.

Rollercoaster was down for maintenance, only 3 dashing cars were under operation, flying cinema was falsely marketed, it's actually a history film on Vietnam, nothing to do with flying.

Only good ride was the swinging monster ride, that was good. zipline was decent, jungle splash was good as well... Water park is very small

Overall just visit this place in case you don't have anywhere else to go.

We actually really enjoyed it, a lot to see. The Moana show was amazing, the aquarium very basic and small, but nice for the young children, the waterpuppet show was cute, my daughter loved it. the ghost house was super funny. The thing is that if you go with your child to the park, you should go there when your child is tall enough to really experience everything. To be honest, I would have rated it between 4 and a 5 stars, but the moment I went to the Safari area, I couldn't go on the boat, first of all, my daughter is too short😅😅😅, then walking through it all and seeing the animals, you can only really see them from the top, not close enough like in the boat. A lot of the animals were locked up. Also, Rhinos and elephants were really a sad thing to see. I come from Africa, so these animals shouldn't live on concrete, also the rhinos are bleeding because of all the flies eating their skin, that means they are not clean. The elephants are chaned upin a small area. They do not look happy at all. The monkey cages are super dirty and stinky, not only inside the cages, but outside too, because of people not knowing where to throw their trash.

I visited this place on November 7, 2021. Many rides have stopped working due to the corona virus, but the entrance fee is the same. Instead, there were very few visitors, so it was very comfortable to use the attraction in operation.

-The animals of all kinds are neglected and look depressed it disheartens me to see these lives kept in this sort of environment.

-No matter your opinion of zoos and animals in captivity argument these creatures do not look okay there cramped and not kept it’s normal surroundings

-the water part was in bad condition the colour of it was green and looks like it’s never been taken cared of bad habitat for the fishes and overall horrific

-It is the park’s responsibility to maintain the balance between entertainment and animals healthcare when I went there was kids and adults banging on the glass with the animals inside and overall rude

-As for the structure, the state is rather big yet doesn’t look like it has been cared for it’s dirty it’s uncared for and overall hard to look at it’s awful to see them put a ride next to safari animals expecting them to deal with that kind of noise

- the only kind of aspect keeping this place at a 2 is the entertainment it’s sort of underwhelming however good and the sort of the entertainment part through my experience it was bad weather and raining heavily

- point is help this place but otherwise don’t go

data.formatted_address: Đường Đ. Phạm Văn Đồng, Xuân Đỉnh, Bắc Từ Liêm, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Hoa Binh Park

reviews.text: Nice Park with a big lake. Very nice for a walk or for playing basketball. People fly kites and little kids drive around in remote controlled cars. There's also a cafe with a nice terrasse.
At 5-6 AM and 17-21 PM overcrowded. Anyway it is great place for running, skating, in-lines, basketball... Only more playgrounds for children is needed.
Perfect place for walking and jogging. Many people with children. Organised WC and trashbins. There is a fountain.

Massive park in the middle of nowhere. Quite beautiful and definitely worth a walk around on a weekend or day off. Hardly anyone there so not sure of the point. There's a small kids entertainment area and paddle boats.
Nice place to relax. Better come at night during the summer, if you want to walk around it. There is a bar for drinks and snacks, street food nearby. Just come and enjoy.

data.formatted_address: 354A Đ. Lê Duẩn, Phương Liên, Đống Đa, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Thong Nhat Park

reviews.text: A serene oasis in the heart of Hanoi! The concept of an island in the middle of a lake within a bustling city is fascinating. Walking around the entire park, crossing the bridge to the island, and observing the aerobics classes, coffee drinkers, and dog walkers was truly delightful. It offers a peaceful retreat from the busy streets outside, making it a beautiful and relaxing place to visit. Highly recommend for a tranquil escape.

Just an amazing park for a relaxing morning, afternoon or evening. Locals and foreigners visit for recreational and social reasons. There is a great trail around the lake with many places to sit and enjoy the ambience of nature. As well, there are several lakeside cafes. Public toilets provided.
This is a large playground. Nice area in the center of the city. I come here to get my own space to read, meditate, walk… I love this place

This is probably the best park at the centre of Hanoi. Walking from the park to the old quarter (around the Sword Lake) takes me about 20 minutes, so it's a pretty convenient location. I've spent about 3 days walking around here every week. It's very calming and definitely great for my mental health. It's also fun to watch the locals playing sports. There are also many beautiful places to take photos in this park. However, sometimes there is stinky smell fron dead fish and dog poop and pee. I'm pretty used to it now, it doesn't bother me much cause i'm only in for the work out (with beautiful nature around me). If you walk, you don't have to pay any fees to get in. You have to pay 5-10k for motorcycle (5 in the morning, 10 in the afternoon).

C 2 miles away from Old Quarter, and a mile away from Ga Hanoi, lies this big, green and spacious park, which surrounds the Bay Mau Lake. The park has multiple entry and exit points. It is well maintained, has two or three tracks in most of the park area ( including one right going right beside the lake ), some recreational spaces for activities like yoga and a few cafes in the premises. The whole lap around the park is about ~1.25 miles.

The park did look a bit dim at various stretches, but no criticism is intended by mentioning the same. Also, toilets seem to be limited, just 2, and one of them was smelling a bit. Water fountain was available at one of the places, and it also had some good flower plantations alongside it.

Overall, its a good park to come and have a walk or run. One can feel the fresh air when going around. There are benches to sit at regular points. It's open till 10 pm, and has no entry fee.

data.formatted_address: Đường D25, Vinhomes Ocean Park 3, Văn Giang, Hưng Yên 17000, Vietnam
data.name: VinWonders Water Park

reviews.text: Beautiful water park with lots of rides. Entrance fee is around $15 for adults and less for kids. Not crowded at all!

Few rides
Small park
Few food choices
Park suspended for two hours 12pm-2pm
VinWonders Hanoi Water Park amazing for everyone coming to with new life

CVN is large and has many games and slides, quite exciting and scary :)) including an indoor artificial beach area. The shower and changing area is clean and spacious. In general, children love it and adults... are tired because swimming in a 100m swimming pool is too long. After doing a few laps, they can only sit and breathe. With the price of 150k ng large on weekends for residents, it is extremely reasonable.

With a ticket price of 250k/adult and 150k/child, this country's tour is quite good for families with young children. Going on weekdays, there are still few customers in the morning, but it's quite crowded in the afternoon.
There are quite a few thrilling games for older kids, and CV is still perfecting a few more games. For children around 3-10 years old, there are many games, in addition to water play, there is also an outdoor land play area. When the weather is cool, it's fun to play.
The park is quite beautifully built, like the Vinwonders Phu Quoc model.
Minus point: because CV closes from 12:00 to 2:00 pm, we need more places to rest. On weekdays, the air-conditioned dining room is full.
Food needs to be more varied because outside food cannot be brought in.
The indoor saltwater swimming pool has several iron holes and quite sharp cement walls, but there are no signs, so if you don't walk carefully, you can easily get hurt. Hopefully CV will be adjusted.

reviews.text: Park itself looks like it would be already 30 years old. Water and the beach are dirty, and bridges are already rusty. There is a main restaurant where only fast food is available. Pizza, burgers are awful. The most important it is not allowed to swim or bath in the lakes from noon until 2.00pm because its lunch time:D really?!... Yes! The entance fee is for 2 adults and a child 25 USD, but for that there are only couple of small slides and the wave pool, which is not working and for a bonus there are literally 2 songs playing the while day.. that's it.
Nice, it was really good. It was really fun to be there😀 😁 😎 😄..... There are also villas to see you can even buy them 👍
Huge park with plenty of different activities you can try. I come to learn SUP and the river is really cool for that. Their staffs are really friendly and caring too. I def would love to come back
Ok
Large and full of entertainment area

reviews.text: Very average social realist sculpture, with one caviat that bumps it up from 2 to 3 stars. It's in the tropics! Tropical Lenin everyone!!! Other than that if you ever visited eastern Europe you must have seen a good  umber of these. The park surrounding it is a lot better than the statue.

Obviously the Statue is the reason to visit this place. Several groups of school children were doing various activities on the plaza in front of the Statue. Behind you have a small park with trees and bench seats aswell as a toilet. Colourful flowers in front of the memorial.
Lively open plaza well used by the public, good atmosphere here & well maintained. Would recommend if you have young children, there are electric cartoon cars & tricycles for them to have fun on
Nothing special here besides Lenin statue which was surrounded by flowers. However, the park was quite nice and clean. Many locals were strolling around and playing soccer in this park.

A great park to spend some time, alone or with friends. It's clean and well maintained. Thanks to the abundance of trees, there is a lot of shade, and places to hang out.

Also dedicated to a true hero of the people, displaying the sort of internationalism and solidarity which the West is sorely lacking.

data.formatted_address: 57B P. Đinh Tiên Hoàng, Hàng Bạc, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre

reviews.text: This is one of my best experiences in Vietnam. I think that nothing can move me like theatre. In 45/60 min they perform life music in front of you and tell you stories about Vietnamese history, culture and traditions. Animation of puppets and music are so good that you no need translation, anyway there's no so many words and whole show. You just need to relax and enjoy. I was on the same show in Saigon but this theatre is much bigger and whole performance is better. I couldn't go to watch it over and over again.

Wonderful, traditional puppet show.
Worth the money for the live musicians and singers alone.
Beautiful theatre with great atmosphere and very cool considering the extreme heat outside.
Comfortable seating.
I had to buy my ticket the previous day as it's always full.  Skilled puppeteers worked their magic for children and adults alike.
Fun show.  It doesn't matter that you can't understand the dialogue.
Gift shop. Clean toilets downstairs.
I recommend for the price especially.
I sat in middle range seats Row G

Amazing experience, bought the ticket directly at the day itself. I would recommend to buy ticket in advance via klook/other app. They offered audio-guide but I did not take it. Although the show was in Vietnamese, I still enjoyed it very much. Kudos to all the performers.

Good one. Try to visit. Nice show. There is a translator outside if you ask and pay they will provide but they are functioning properly. The story sequence doesn't go properly with the translator. The same story line kept repeating multiple times in our translator which is very uncomfortable. We complained but they didn't take any action. I don't think translators do their job. Recommend seeing it without translator.

Super fun experience for our first night in Hanoi! Affordable tickets which you can purchase on the night at the book or with a ticketing agency like we did.

The atmosphere of the theatre was cozy and small but nevertheless impressive. The show was spectacular with beautiful traditional cultural music that encompassed live instruments and singing.

The puppet show was amusing, entertaining and very impressive. For a short one hour show it's definitely worth visiting and watching as a means of embracing the culture and supporting the years old artistic tradition.

data.formatted_address: 11 P. Hàng Vôi, Lý Thái Tổ, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Ceramic mosaic mural road

reviews.text:
The Ceramic Mosaic Mural Road in Hanoi showcases some truly remarkable mosaic artistry that stretches over a considerable distance. The level of detail and creativity in these mosaics is commendable, making it a worthwhile stop for art enthusiasts and tourists alike.

However, it's worth noting that the road is unfortunately situated right next to a noisy and polluted street in Hanoi, which somewhat detracts from the overall enjoyment. The constant traffic and dust from the road can make it challenging to fully appreciate the beauty of the mosaics.

It's disappointing that such a fantastic display of artistry is located in such close proximity to an unpleasant environment. The Ceramic Mosaic Mural Road deserves a more serene and tranquil setting to truly allow visitors to immerse themselves in the artwork. Nonetheless, if you can look past the distractions of the street, the mosaics themselves are undeniably impressive.

Nice place to take pictures. My partner and I enjoyed par of the walk (the whole walk is 5-6km) although it is a bit chaotic due to the traffic. There is a bridge to cross the road. The quality of the mosaic is good and it makes it an interesting place to take alternative picture

It’s cool to see for a short while but it is hot as it’s right by the highway. We did have to step over a dead rat and a fair bit of rubbish to walk along a small section of it. Don’t go out of your way for it, but if it’s on the way to your next destination it’s a nice little thing to see.
Rough to find, ceramic road next to express road, its ok to see but not a "must see place"
Really liked the mosaic wall. Only downside is that it’s on the side of the very busy road, so you have to be careful to stay on the sidewalk and not get hit by anything haha

data.formatted_address: 6 P. Lê Văn Thiêm, Thanh Xuân Trung, Thanh Xuân, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Smart Kids Playground

reviews.text:
Smart Kids Playground is very spacious, located on the 3A floor, offering a variety of games for children. The weekend ticket price is 190K, and I think it's 140K during weekdays (I'm not sure). Adults don't have to buy tickets and the children can play for as long as they want. You can also purchase drinks and food inside the play area, and the quality is decent.
The place is usually not too crowded with kids, so there's plenty of space to play. However, some items are worn out and need replacement. The staff is polite and can play with the children. Cars and motorcycles can be parked on the internal road or in the spacious basement parking lot.

Paradise for toddlers and kids (and parents) in Hanoi! The 1 day pass is just 140k and adults do not pay. It is pretty big, clean and safe. As parent you can even work with laptop. Staff have a look on children too and they are very polite. They are on 3A floor.

Nice & clean space for small children to spend the weekend. They have an area for parents to sit and chill while keeping an eye on the kids. The staff are all very friendly, helpful and nice. They have stage area for events as well.
Clean and spacious place for kids to play whole day.
What a pleasant surprise in town. The right spot for some good time kids would enjoy. As well as parents.

data.formatted_address: 40c P. Hàng Mành, Hàng Gai, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Hanoi Old Quarter Travel

reviews.text: The second time I visited Hanoi, I went back here and booked another day trip to Ninh Binh this time. Again, everything is upfront and prices are good. Thuy is very friendly and helpful. The whole family is good, hardworking people. The trip was great--everything as explained and very nice and friendly tour guide and bus driver (beautiful scenery, nature). Again, I can't emphasize how great this place is especially given how tourism business works at many popular destinations. 200/100 recommend !

Excellent coordination and arrangements
Booked best in class rooms within walkable attractions  . I enquired with many tour operators and this was more affordable than others
Made up our vacation memorable
They have good network around Vietnam and are flexible with payments. All services including taxi was on time
Food and  menus provided to us as per our choice  and requirements and we don’t feel it difficult & enjoyed the cuisine
English was spoken very fluently by all guides arranged
Strongly recommend all to utilize there services and we will surely come back to Vietnam

Great service, good price, and extra lovely owner.
We went to this tour group to book a last-minute trip to Ha Long and some train tickets for further travel.
The owner, Tung, was welcoming and helpful, and he was not pushy at all, like other tour companies.
We booked our trip to Ha long and a night in Ninh Bin, then train tickets to Da nang, and everything went great!
Tung was available via whatsapp the entire time to answer questions we had,  and the only time we had a delay (someone else's mistake) he promptly got in touch and sorted everything, so there was no stress at all.
All for a very fair price!
Would highly recommend using this agency, and would definitely use Tung's service again next time we're in Vietnam 🙂

We had a splendid one day trip from Hanoi to Halong Bay! 🔥🔥 Everything was really well managed. Food was delicious, but the best part was the breathtaking view. Price was also ok, not expensive. Recommend it 100%!

There are no words to express my gratitude for Mrs. Thuy Bui and Hanoi Old Quarter Travel! I am an anxious planner who had the great idea of taking 4 generations of our family ages 15 to 83 on an international adventure to Vietnam. I literally wrote Thuy almost every day for 7 months and she responded and planned the trip of a lifetime! She made sure our 15 year old had adventure and my grandma 83 was able to be there with us! She even surprised us with serval upgrades on our cruise and our resort time in Nihn Binh. On our 10 day trip there was not a moment where I had one bit of anxiety which is crazy for a person like me! Thuy literally changed our lives! Thank you thank you thank you! Every guide and recommendation Thuy made was top notch! If you want to experience Vietnam work with this team!!!!

All was perfect!
Thanks to Minh to the perfect timing of the bike tour
A great experience to visit famous spots in Hanoi
Good service, very delicious food. The tour guide is knowledgeable, leads the tour, and speaks very well. Cycling is tiring but very fun

data.formatted_address: 3 Đ. Hoàng Hoa Thám, Ngọc Hồ, Ba Đình, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Vườn bách thảo Hà Nội

reviews.text:
Nice park, can't walk on the grass. Lots of locals enjoying the green space.

Unfortunately the man who parks the bikes tried to scam us by charging us even tho we didn't have a bike.

Monkey's in a very small cage with the smell of ammonia.

For these reasons that is why I have given it 2 star.

I visited recently and paid 2000VND to enter. The garden itself had a quiet ambiance, which was somewhat relaxing.

However, I couldn't overlook the poor conditions of the caged animals. It felt like a step back in time, and frankly, it's surprising that such practices still exist today.

As I walked through, I couldn't help but wonder about the necessity of keeping animals in such conditions. It's something that needs serious reconsideration.

Overall, the visit left me with mixed feelings – a peaceful environment tainted by outdated practices.

This is a botanical garden in the center of Hanoi. It is not the most impressive garden from a botanical perspective but it is a very beautiful park and a very welcoming break from the crowds and noise in Hanoi. The gardens are big and the park also offers an outdoor arts display of sculptures from different international artists.
Nice trees. Disappointing to see dude fishing in the botanical gardens lake. Security guard didn't seem to care blackout it either, despite the signs saying fishing is forbidden.  Crazy. Lol.
One of (if not) the most historic, well-reserved botanical places in the city of Ha Noi. Very close to the West Lake and Old Quarter’ streets.

data.formatted_address: 42 P. Nhà Chung, Hàng Trống, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Vườn Hoa Hàng Trống

reviews.text:
Vườn Hoa Hàng Trống offers more than just a library—it's a tranquil oasis nestled within a bustling city. The exterior boasts a beautiful park adorned with vibrant flowers and well-placed seating, inviting visitors to unwind and soak in the serenity of nature.

As a library, it provides a peaceful retreat for book lovers seeking solace amidst the urban chaos. The serene ambiance and comfortable seating make it an ideal spot to delve into a good book or simply enjoy the tranquility of the surroundings.

Whether you're a bookworm in search of literary inspiration or simply seeking a moment of respite from the hustle and bustle of city life, Vườn Hoa Hàng Trống offers a serene sanctuary where you can relax, recharge, and reconnect with nature.
A nice park which is located next to the St John Cathedral at the Hanoi Old Quarter. It is one of the good place in the city centre to just rest, play, or having picnic.
I passed by this place when I visited Hanoi St. Joseph’s Cathedral. It looked nice.

Nice green park by Hanoi Cathedral offers fresh and green space for people to stroll around, take in fresh air while walking, doing exercises, yoga or meditation. Within the compound lies a central library sets a nice colonial villa over shadowed with trees lines, flowers and bonsai. It is a place for youngers, students to do reading or home works, elderly people encounter and chatting. It is a good place to release tension or refresh, rest and relaxation or throw deep thoughts on life or business. Visitors pass by taking pictures, writing postcards in this nice atmosphere and send homes with local stories, legends and anecdotes.
Nice place. Beautiful building and big garden. You can relax and enjoy the green view here.

The Temple of Literature is a cool place to visit. It’s peaceful and not too crowded. We did not get the audio tour but wished we would have in order to learn more than what you can read on the signs.
A good learning experience on the culture of Vietnam! Thanks to our guide for explaining the history of this temple!
Very ancent, peaceful and nice! This is a famous and historic place where tourist persons should visit once coming to Ha Noi, Vietnam.
A really cool historical place, first university in Vietnam and the Temple of literature.

data.formatted_address: 28A Điện Biên Phủ, Điện Biên, Ba Đình, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Statue of Lenin

reviews.text: A playground for your kids in oldquarters.
Statues dedicated to Lenin. In the morning there are people dancing and exercising in the park.
Best spot in Hanoi. Flat ground, long ledge, manual pad

It was located in the middle of the museums and tourist spots actually right front of the flag tower that allows you can visit on the way this small and clean Lenin park. Five stars park  for the respect of Lenin monument. Maybe you can sit and take a break if you are tired.

Public garden named after Vladimir Ilyich Lenin.  The monument to Lenin, by sculptor A. Tyurenkov was erected in the park in 1982.  The name of Lenin on the monument is written in Vietnamese - “V.  I. Lê Nin. "  At the opening ceremony was attended by a member of the Politburo of the CPSU Central Committee Mikhail Gorbachev.  The monument is a gift for the V Congress of the Communist Party of Vietnam. Historical park. there are many young people nearby.  children play and ride.  Lenin looks at it and rejoices.

data.formatted_address: 6 Ng. Hội Vũ, Hàng Bông, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: The Hanoi Social Club

reviews.text: This is a cute little gem located in a small alley off the most touristy areas. The place is really soft with art pieces on the wall and bohemic furniture. The staff are really nice and they all speak English. I ordered the poached egg toast which was enough for me to get full and my boyfriend ordered the black bean plate since it was gluten free and vegan. His dish was nice but he missed the zingy cream fraiche which was taken away due to his lactose intolerance. He made it up tho with the flour less chocolate cake, so good. We would recommend anyone to choose one of their versions of Vietnamese coffee, both the ice coffee with condensed milk and the coconut salted coffee was amazing 🤩

Comfy easygoing three level bistro with a good mix of European and Vietnamese fusion food and drinks. The burger 🍔 patties were fantastic. Good service. Google locations services can get a bit spotty nearby so ask around if you end up at a different entrance!

It’s a charming small building which was under renov on the first floor with so retro deco. The french toast which mangho and a hint of cinammon on the bread is nice. The literal orange on chocolaye orange cake is cute touch, but it taste good as well. The coconut coffee is not too sweet. Really enjoyable place for brunch. The servers speaks well english as well. Worth to go in Hanoi

Hanoi Social Club offers a cozy atmosphere and a diverse menu. While the mushroom pasta was a miss, vegetarian burger , the coconut coffee and egg coffee were delightful highlights. Overall, it's a great spot for breakfast or a relaxing coffee break.

Hanoi Social Club is a charming oasis in the heart of the bustling city. Nestled in a historic building, this café exudes a relaxed vibe that makes it the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of Hanoi. The menu at Hanoi Social Club offers a delightful selection of dishes that cater to both locals and travelers alike. From hearty breakfast options to flavorful lunches and decadent desserts, each bite is a testament to the café's commitment to quality and flavor.

data.formatted_address: Đ. Phạm Hùng, Mễ Trì, Nam Từ Liêm, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Hanoi Museum

reviews.text: A great place to discover the city's history and culture. A minor thing is that the museum sections were not well organized since there is not any directory to tell what is being displayed on each floor.
Wonderful museum you should put on your destination list while in Hanoi. The building architecture was so on point. No entrance ticket

For art and history lovers.
Don't mix this place with a history museum.
There you can find 3 floors and each floor has different exceptions related to history (1st floor) or modern art (2nd floor). From time to time, they change compositions itself so you can visit a place when they update it.

And btw, there is a nice garden, a place to chill and take a picture. But noooot in hot weather.
Free entrance!)

I don't get this museum AT ALL. I wouldn't even call it a museum. It's more like an exhibition hall. I didn't understand what the museum was about or who it was for. The only thing I can think of is that it's a place designed to make you feel uncomfortable and confused. I wandered through labyrinths of creepy paintings and sculptures with genitalia, then suddenly found myself in a small room with stuffed animals.... Then I went higher up a spiral passageway with a rather low railing (for a person of height 170 the railing is at buttock level) and found myself in a room with pictures of war and bombs. And opposite there was something about dinosaurs... but the passage was closed. Then a half-empty hall, pictures of leaders... It's a very strange place. I give it a high rating because it's free. And it was a kind of a thrill to feel so uncomfortable and strange.
The outside of the museum does not need the ticket. But at the same time, the outside park has enough of scenes for good photos. Highly recommend for the photoshoot with the traditional clothes

data.formatted_address: 36 P. Lý Thường Kiệt, Hàng Bài, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Vietnamese Women's Museum

reviews.text: This large and spacious museum shares interesting information on the many Vietnamese ethnic groups ways of life - from marriage, family, the fight for independence and fashion. There is a lift to the upper levels too. Gift shop downstairs with all the usual Hanoi posters, postcards and trinkets.

Amazing place to learn about Vietnamese culture, and tradition. The museum is separate on different topics, each floor is one topic from the culture and history of Vietnamese women. There are lots of things to see and learn about family, fashion and important women from history.  I highly recommend this museum for all museum lovers.

Through Vietnamese’s lens, museum shares about history of women’s contribution in the family. They also show important women who contributed to Vietnam.

Tickets are priced at VND40,000 per person. They also provide recorded audio explanation at VND40,000. Do note that they only accept cash payment.

So note the their last entry to the museum seems to be around 7pm.

The exhibition is organised into the following sections: Marriage, Family Life, Women's Fashion, and Women in History. To anyone of mildly feminist sensibilities, this might seem like a questionable choice of topics. To be fair however, the 'Family' section is entirely (!) about planting and harvesting rice. 'Women in History' covers the period 1933-1975 and is nearly exclusively about women fighting and killing Americans. To be fair, there is a small section titled "Destiny of Today's Women" which mentions jobs available to women and a number of very capitalist success stories of female entrepreneurs. (PS: The men's room is in pristine condition.)
Must visit when you come to Hanoi, you can learn and understand a lot about Vietnam history and traditions throughout the women of this country.

data.formatted_address: Đ. Nguyễn Văn Huyên, Quan Hoa, Cầu Giấy, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Vietnam Museum of Ethnology

reviews.text: When visiting Hanoi is good to visit this museum as well. It’s not the most impressive museum of the world but you will see items of the everyday life of the more than 50 ethnological tribals living in Vietnam. The museum is indoor but outdoor as well. One and a half hour is more than enough. The entrance fee is very low: €1,50. In the same place there are also 2 coffee shops.

I really enjoyed this museum. It had so many interesting informations and I learnt a lot. Probably with a guided your you can get more insights, but the information available in the descriptions was already a lot. The garden is also incredibly nice with all the different types of houses. Really a must see in Hanoi if you enjoy these types of museums.

One of the best museums I've been to. Super interesting with loads to look at. Fashion, arts, architecture. Can easily spend a couple of hours here. Inside has air con and outside is nicely shaded so good activity for a hot day.

This museum is fantastic. A great way to learn about Vietnam, but also really the whole world! There are two very well air-conditioned  buildings. One building is for South East Asia more broadly, some works from all over the world, and a rotating exhibit (currently about everyday life in Korea). The second building is just about the different people of Vietnam.

I learned so much through the signs in the South East Asia building about the pieces and how they relate to the culture.

The Vietnamese building was also interesting with some videos to watch - and it looked like you might be able to get an audio tour but I couldn’t see any signs to buy one.

The outdoor area was my favourite - but very hot as we went in summer. You can go into all the houses, and the signs explain what part of Vietnam the houses are from. There are also tombs and boats to look at, and lots of shade from all the trees.

Note: To enter the homes, you must take your shoes off. Wear some easy to take on and off shoes! ☺️

There are 2 cafes, toilets and 2 souvenir shops too. For 40k ticket entrance, this is a must see. We really enjoyed our time and spent maybe 3 hours here, and got a hibiscus iced tea at the cafe after.

Only thing is getting a taxi when you leave is not super easy. We walked down the road a bit until we found one driving by.

It's the best place to visit in Hanoi. There are very interesting exhibitions inside and outside, telling about the life of different ethnic groups in Vietnam. The ticket price is 40000 for adults and 10000 for kids. The Museum open from 8-30 am till 5-30 pm, Monday is day off.  Audio guide is available there

data.formatted_address: 157 P. Đội Cấn, Ngọc Hồ, Ba Đình, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: B52 Victory Museum

reviews.text: It’s free to see the things outside there is a B-52 fortress bomber that was shot down by the Vietnamese it’s way bigger than you expect. Pretty cool to see in person.

To be honest after being in Saigon war museum I expected something similar with full informations about the war and consequences. Unfortunately this museum is only about this shot down B52, maybe that's why it's free entrance.

Interesting museum about B-52 attack to Hanoi. Not so big, but entrance is free. Most of labels is also in English. Outside is big part of B-52, Mig-21 and some air defence weapons. Parking for motorbikes is next to museum and it was also free.

My visit to the B-52 Victory Museum in Vietnam was a bittersweet experience that left me with mixed emotions. Walking through the museum, I was struck by the undeniable historical significance of the exhibits, particularly the American planes shot down during the war. It was a poignant reminder of the conflicts and sacrifices endured by both sides. As an American, seeing the wreckage of our planes was a sobering moment that stirred up complex emotions. On one hand, it was a reminder of the devastation of war and the human cost involved. On the other hand, it served as a catalyst for reflection and dialogue, fostering a deeper understanding of the past and the need for reconciliation. While it was a challenging experience, it ultimately offered an opportunity for introspection and healing. The B-52 Victory Museum is a place where history is preserved, and important lessons are learned. A visit here is a journey of remembrance and reflection that is both sobering and enlightening.
I honestly cannot believe this is free. I had a great time visiting. There is a B52, MiG21, and various AAA/SAM and radar exhibits outside. Inside, there are 2 floors on the Vietnam War.

data.formatted_address: Km 15, QL6, Yên Nghĩa, Hà Đông, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Ho Chi Minh Trail Museum

reviews.text: Quite interesting. Nice exhibits. But young staff with very little life experience have nothing to offer except nationalistic pride. More insightful and thoughtful guides would be nicer.

A comprehensive documentation of the struggle and eventual victory of the Vietnamese people during the War of American Aggression. Very informative exhibits and movie showing the level of infrastructure required to defend the motherland. Limited visitors and tourists visit the museum due to the distance from downtown Hanoi. If there is one museum to see about the war this is the one I recommend. Superb exhibits, a large outdoor memorial to those who lost their lives, equipment used and a professionally produced movie with interactive 3-D map. 20,000 dong admission. Hours posted are correct.

A wonderful museum! The staff were so helpful and knowledgeable. My favourite part of the museum was the 3D map which was used during the 20 minute film which was shown before the tour. About 30 minutes including metro and a short walk from the centre of Hanoi.

Upon entering, you'll notice the absence of staff. Instead, the museum embraces a minimalist approach, allowing the raw information about the war to take center stage. The place was totally empty, no one apart from us. The lack of embellishments creates a weird ambiance.

Despite the unconventional presentation, the museum's dedication to providing information is commendable. The displays, though minimalistic, are packed with factual details, archival materials, and compelling narratives. Go with an open mind and form your own interpretation.

CLOSED FOR RENOVATION UNTIL EARLY 2018.
We found out the hard way. No official information posted anywhere confirming this, but a quick internet search will confirm it. Give it a miss for now!

data.formatted_address: 173C Đ. Trường Chinh, Khương Mai, Thanh Xuân, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Air Force and Air Defence Museum

reviews.text:
My dad and I went here last minute but we enjoyed going around the place. We wanted to spend more time but the museum was closing already.

The indoor museum had a lot of interesting info but they were all in Vietnamese. Hopefully, they do an English translation as well or provide audio guides for different languages.

The collection of artifacts were amazing. They were well preserved and looked incredible up close.
Best Museum in hanoi in my opinion, one reason is because they translate everything in english for stranger people like me who Do Not speak unfortnaly Vietnamese. I enjoyed. Thank you.
Great place // so cheap for a mornings trip // when visiting you need check weather as 50% is out side , not good to go when raining
It is an interesting and educational destination, we had a great time there.

Place seemed great, but it was so hard to talk to ticket seller, who couldnt speak a single word in english and was very unhelpful.
Probably the outside complex is free and inside museum cost money.

data.name: Keangnam Landmark Tower 72

reviews.text:
I got to see the panoramic view of Hanoi and enjoy the extremely bustling and fun atmosphere at Q bar. The drinks are delicious and very satisfying, so for me just one glass is not enough.
The staff is very lovely, enthusiastic and takes good care of me. Their thoughtful support helps make my experience better, 10 service points. I really had an experience that exceeded my expectations.

Experience wine at QBar, the drinks are delicious, the staff are also very cute. I ordered Ramos Gin Fizz and I rated it as excellent! Very delicious, the staff also took the trouble to adjust to my taste so I could have the best experience

Hotel service is great, especially the staff at Q Bar.
The menu is very diverse, especially cocktails inspired by the northwestern mountains of Vietnam.
Exceeded expectations and will come back with my family.

Landmark 72 Kaengnam offers a breathtaking experience. The panoramic views are stunning, and the service is top-notch. However, the dining options could be more diverse. Overall, a remarkable landmark worth visiting.

data.name: InterContinental Hanoi Landmark72, an IHG Hotel

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Intercontinental Hanoi Landmark Hotel and had an outstanding experience. The convenience of nearby amenities made my stay extremely comfortable, as everything I needed was just a short walk away.One highlight of my visit was the 3 Spoons breakfast restaurant. The buffet selection was both diverse and delicious, offering a range of cuisines that catered to all tastes. From freshly baked pastries to savory dishes, every item was prepared to perfection.I was also impressed by the exceptional service provided by the staff, particularly QuyNH. Her attentive and friendly demeanor made dining at 3 Spoons even more enjoyable. She went above and beyond to ensure that all guests had a pleasant experience.Overall, I highly recommend the Intercontinental Hanoi Landmark Hotel, especially for the delightful breakfast experience at 3 Spoons.

My family of 5 had a wonderful stay at this hotel! It was exceeded our expectations! We especially enjoyed the service in the club Lounge. One of the managers Anh was especially sweet and went out of her way to make our stay especially memorable!  The rest of the staff was amazing too! If we ever find our way back to Hanoi we will definitely be staying here!

We were served by K.Vi at the Hive Lounge and it was a wonderful experience !! The food and drinks and atmosphere were all wonderful, and my parents and I loved the afternoon tea set. Definitely recommend coming here to avoid the heat and have a lovely afternoon.

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The hotel is new, clean and modern, but is a little bit far from the downtown area. The view from our room was amazing, and the hotel staff especially Ms. Thao, Ms. Dieu, and Ms. Trang at the Club Lounge were very nice. They took care of us very well. They went above and beyond to celebrate my wife’s birthday with a delicious chocolate cake. Ms. Trang also worked with the kitchen to serve us Vietnamese spring rolls which were not a typical menu in the Club Lounge. We had a good time and will stay at this hotel if we ever come back to Hanoi again.

Outstanding hotel, just gets better & better. The concierge service was great and Ms Hoa helped me hugely with some work requirements. Rooms are very comfortable and the new toiletries are sensational, I’m going to find them for my home. Breakfast is an extravagant feast. Thoroughly enjoy staying here mostly because of the staff and their genuine friendliness.

data.formatted_address: 62nd Floor, Hanoi Landmark72 Tower Plot E6, Cau Giay New Urban Area Me Tri Ward, Keangnam, Nam Từ Liêm, Hà Nội 10000, Vietnam
data.name: The Hive Lounge

reviews.text: Afternoon tea was terrible quality! Sandwiches at Circle K taste better! Low quality bread with tomatoes and carrots, really?  What do you take your customers for??? Since there’s not much competition in Hanoi, Intercontinental probably thought they could relax and serve the crappiest quality bread with veggies for savory snacks. Terrible bread with some carrot!! Not even a slice of salmon?? How expensive would that be that be? It’s tiny anyway. Why save so much? Disappointed! You really couldn’t pull that off in Bangkok. It can’t be any worse. I can’t believe we ordered 2 sets! Big mistake. Money wasted! Do not recommend! Price 899k per 1 set. Not worth it. Save your time and money for something better than this.

Amazing. All staffs are very polite and accomodating, especially Linh Thanh Minh. We enjoyed Nachos, Wagyu cheese burgur and a pot of peach tea. Staffs helped us to share food and gave us hot water refill. In addtion, the atmosphere has good vibes. We'll come back soon. Thanks!

The team at the Hive Lounge Intercontinental Landmark 72 Hanoi is so gracious. They accommodated our multiple time changes for afternoon tea. We were warmly by greeted by Ms. Linh Diem – she and every person who served us were lovely. They made sure we always had enough hot water for our tea and the tea treats were beautifully made. We enjoyed the relaxing ambience in the lounge and watched the sunset. Glad we choose this lovely spot to bring our guest.

A really lovely place to spend the afternoon comfortably for hi tea. The hi tea set had a good balance or sweets and savories. I was alone and upon request they managed to accommodate the hi tea set for 1 person. The beverage menu lacked decaf tea selection so if you are sensitive to caffeine but want something hot, the only choices are chocolate drink or decaf coffee.

Great experience! We booked afternoon tea, the food and service was so good, I ordered tea and got constant refills on hot water. There was live piano, sax and singer during our meal. Lovely staff (Ms Viet and Ms Nam thank you!) :)
