data.formatted_address: 78a Đ. Trần Nhật Duật, Đồng Xuân, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Hanoi Street Food Tour

reviews.text: Excellent 3hr food tour. Apple was our guide & she was great. Very reasonably priced for the amount of time (& food)! Apple wrote down all we tried & where we ate after & reco' other things to do/see. Highly recommend.

I have three questions in mind when it comes to a walking food tour. Firstly, is the food good? Absolutely! I just finished my meal and it was absolutely delicious. I'm writing this review right now with a full and happy belly.

Secondly, is the tour guide good? Yes, our guide was "Apple" and she was awesome. We enjoyed her company and learned about Vietnamese culture through food. It was a great experience…

Lastly, is the tour worth it? Absolutely! We didn't have to worry about where we were going or what to do. Apple took care of everything - not only did she choose great dishes, but she also explained how to eat them the right way…to get the full taste.

Overall, we loved the experience and had a wonderful time. The tour took us through winding streets and places we may not have visited. Highly recommended!

We had the most amazing time with our guide Helen Nguyen! The tour was nicely adapted for vegetarians and everything we ate was super tasty. We got inside stories about Hanoi, the best places for different plates and coffee and really nice quality time with our guide.

Helen made us feel cared for and you can see how she likes the city, the country and it's food. She also took us to a market and helped us buying and trying out different fruits.

If you are in Hanoi, don't hesitate taking this fantastic street food tour! Ask for Helen as your guide. She made our time in Hanoi even more special.

Thao was out tour guide and I couldn’t recommend this Street Food Tour anymore! We loved being able to try different, authentic foods that we wouldn’t normally go for, or know where to find. Thao’s English was exceptional, and her strive to ensure we had the best time was high. This tour exceeded expectations. Thank you Thao.

We just completed an amazing food tour with Apple. She was a real gem. Lovely. Interesting and fun to spend an evening with. She had us try so many different types of food and explained how to eat them. We truly enjoyed our evening with Apple. Highly recommend checking out this tour.

data.formatted_address: 3b P. Hàng Tre, Phố cổ Hà Nội, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Hanoi Backstreet Tours/ Hanoi Motorbike Tours/ Hanoi Jeep Tours/ Hanoi Vespa Tours/ Hanoi Sidecar Tours

reviews.text:
This is the second time I have booked this tour and have had the best time yet again! Louis was a wonderful guide again, even remembering me and my friend from last year. He looked after us well throughout the tour and is so informative at each stop!
I also have to give recognition to all of the drivers, they are so skilled at manoeuvring around the Hanoi traffic and at all times we felt very safe. My mum is not a big fan of bikes but her driver, Lam, made her feel very comfortable and safe, she also commented on how chatty he was and told her lots about Vietnam. My driver, Snow, was also a wonderful driver and we also had a great time chatting throughout the entire tour.
I would highly recommend this tour. The team is great, you learn so much and there is great food at the end of the trip! Thank you to the team so much for another wonderful evening in Hanoi!

If you are looking for a well professional organized tour in Vietnam, don’t look any further: We had the best tour @ the Hanoi Backstreet Tours! Our guide Fred was very nice and had a lot of stories and history to share about the city. She and driver Mr.B  do everything to make it comfortable for you (we had 3 kids). It was very nice to meet her uncle who is a Vietnamese veteran. And we are very thankful that he shared his stories with us. And last but not least, the Hidden Gem diner was 👌🏽

I recently had an amazing experience on this tour! The food was absolutely delicious, and the tour itself was incredibly well-organized. However, the highlight of the trip was our fantastic tour guide. She was not only extremely knowledgeable and humorous, but also a wonderful photographer and an outstanding guide. Her expertise and engaging personality truly made the tour unforgettable. Thank you for such a memorable experience!

The motorbike tour with Q as our guide was absolutely amazing. His knowledge of the area as well as small facts was incredible. I could not recommend enough doing a tour with this company. It was an amazing way to see Vietnam! The back of the motorbike felt very safe with Vin, and you can get in touch with local culture and non-touristy spots with ease. It is more than worth the money, as when you the hidden gem office (which doubles up as a beautiful cafe) you will be presented with a selection of local dishes and egg coffee too! There are many small souvenirs provided throughout too. Thank you Hanoi backstreet tours!!

Han was the guide on our half day city tour today. The tour was very informative and entertaining. Han was an excellent guide. He told us much of the history and many things about the places that we visited. Han speaks excellent English and I would highly recommend him for your tour.

data.formatted_address: 24 P. Lý Quốc Sư, Hàng Trống, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội 110207, Vietnam
data.name: Le Petit Hanoi Travel

reviews.text: Very nice rooms and the girls where exceptionally attentive to us. There was some noise due to construction in the building and they offered to cover our taxi expenses to the airport to make up for it. Room was clean and at a great location too

My wife and I booked a 1 day tour to trang an through them. They offered us a "standard" or "deluxe" package and explained to us that if we upgrade to the deluxe we would have a much more comfortable ride and that the food would be better. With a 3hr ride to trang an she sold us on "more space" and less people on the tour and used words like luxurious.  And of course my wife and I appreciate good food so why not? We're on vacation. She told us that both standard and deluxe food is all you can eat buffet. I even asked her when we go to eat lunch do they just divide people into the standard and deluxe group for upgraded food? She said yes there are two places to eat there.

So instead of the standard $25 per person we paid $40 for the deluxe. The day of the van picks us up. It was cramped. The seats were so tightly packed that your knees were pressed up against the seat in front of you. My wife and I are not big by any means. Both of us are slim Asians under 5'7". We sat fetal position the whole way. On top of that the van was packed. Every one was shoved in like sardines with every seat taken and could hardly move. My leg fell asleep from being in one position so long.

When we arrived at the rest stop restaurant there were a lot of tour guide vans from different travel agencies pulling in and leading all their customers in to eat. Literally everyone ate there. There was no other food options and it was horrendous. I found hair stuck in my food and lost my appetite. I asked the tour guide if this was the only place to eat and if everyone ate here? And he said yes. At this point my wife and I knew that this "deluxe" package was a scam. There's no difference. They just want you to pay more.

After the tour we went back and complained and she gave us the run around with poor excuses. Saying that our deluxe ride had less people than the standard. (Despite the fact every seat was taken) and that there was another restaurant we should have ate at.

I have no problem with the tour itself. But the travel agency le petit is dishonest.

The best travel agent in Hanoi.
The staffs very helpful and arrange the tour and the train/bus tickets for us. The price for the tours are reasoanble and we really enjoy the tours.
Thank you everything for Chee, we appreciate a lot.
We stayed there for four nights. Rooms are cosy. Arrange and booked our tours in Hanoi. Really enjoyed the stay.
In evening and night, two travel agents work. Anh and Chi I guess!!! Wonderful, helpful, polite and reasonably priced booking that synca with Google Calendar... :)

data.formatted_address: Level 9, Thang Long Number One - Tower A, 88 Láng Hạ, street, Đống Đa, Hà Nội 10000, Vietnam
data.name: A Taste of Hanoi

reviews.text: Taste of Hanoi arranged an amazing tour for my family, exploring the streets, war tour and Halong Bay all in style. The team were amazing at organising and making sure everyone had a great time. Definitely recommend.

I made a last minute booking for a wrong date and they were able to accommodate us in such a short notice. Very friendly guides, excellent drivers and great communication skills from Brian the owner. Highly recommended!

Rosie was our guide and we learned a lot about all the bits and bites that we tasted. We  had 10 different tastings from noodles dishes to desserts and beer! I really recommend taking this tour at the beginning of your travels so you can use all the new knowledge on the next days :)
We have really enjoyed working alongside Brian and A Taste of Hanoi in 2023.  Very much looking forward to visiting Vietnam and we know Brian will make sure it's an excellent experience.

Vu was the most wonderful guide! We booked on the website and everything was very easy. I let them know we were mostly a vegetarian crew, and Vu did a great job accommodating our dietary restrictions. It was an incredible tour! We ate little snacks from 12 different places, explored many places we would never have been able to find on our own, learned about new dishes and also the history of Hanoi, and had a wonderful time. I would recommend this tour to anyone! And definitely don’t worry if you are vegetarian (or vegan) — they understand your restrictions and can give you an amazing tour. This was the perfect way to start our first morning in Hanoi.

data.formatted_address: 5 P. Ấu Triệu, Hàng Trống, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Ha Giang Loop Tour from Hanoi

reviews.text:
Absolutely amazing trip! Definitely the best part of visiting Vietnam! Would recommend to anybody who visits HaNoi to do the Ha Giang loop tour with Cheers Hostel! Met so many other people who love traveling and made so many new friends!

The staff were very professional while also having great fun with everybody!

10/10 would definitely go again!
Highly recommended this motorbike tour in Ha Giang. It was an adventurous one for 3 days.

The Ha Giang Loop was the absolute highlight of our trip to Vietnam. We first wanted to try and organize it for ourselves and drive ourselves, but ended up going with this organized tour and that was the best decision we could have made.

First of all having the drivers that are actually locals from the area provided an amazing experience, allowing us to see the ins and outs and the hidden gems of this beautiful piece of the planet. We stayed at local home stays, had truly lovely food all along the way and really got in touch with the locals.

The way this is set up also really supports the locals, a great bonus.

Been travelling SEA for 4 months and this was the best experience so far! Cheers hostel’s professionalism for the whole 3 days was amazing, the views speak for themselves and the easy riders were so friendly, couldn’t recommend this enough to anyone visiting Vietnam

I've just completed the Ha Giang loop  Epic tour with Cheers hostel (booked via the One Hostel in Hanoi which I think is owned by the same people.) I had a great few days. My driver Hoàng was brilliant, he made feel really safe all the time, was really kind, spoke really good English and took me to viewpoints that were less touristy and really beautiful. The places we stayed in were great too and the evening activities with everybody like dinner, drinks and karaoke were really fun. I've never done anything like this before and it was a really memorable experience. The transport was also a luxury sleeper bus which was very nice.

Only minor things I'd mention is that I had a couple of small issues but Cheers hostel were very accommodating and helped me solve them very quickly and sorted out different changes for me. One was that I'd been booked on the wrong outgoing bus (as I was coming from Sa pa rather than hanoi) so they organised for me to have a beer and snack at the place I was waiting as an apology. The other was that I had booked on the four day tour but when it started it turned out I was the only person on it (as I think the three day must be the standard / more popular one that most people do.) In the end we organised something where I was able to join the three day people for all the social activities like lunch, dinner,  swimming in a waterfall and then in the day basically had a private motorbike tour (as I was the only person in my group) which was actually really special and worked out to be the best of both.

Thank you very much for a great trip!

data.formatted_address: 23 P. Mã Mây, Phố cổ Hà Nội, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Hanoi Free Walking Tours

reviews.text:
A Vietnamese friend told me about Hanoi Free Walking Tours before we went to Vietnam, most tour guides are College students who are trained by the group and these students also want to practice speaking in English thru the tours. We booked for 2 tours, the War sites Walking Tour and the Street Food Walking Tour. Mr. Chien and Alex ( his english name) a College student for the 1st tour, and Robin ( his english name) also a College student for the 2nd tour, but for the 2nd tour we invited Alex to also join us because both students were of the same age level as my son, it was a pleasant experience to tour around Hanoi with them.

They are both knowledgeable, very friendly and polite. They speak good english too. We did not only learned many things from them but  we gained new friends in Vietnam and we hope to be back and will surely book other tours with this group again. After the tour I was looking for a hand sanitizer but we were not able to find one on our way back to the hotel with the student guides, after few hours the hotel staff came to our room with 2 bottles of hand sanitizer and told me it was given by the student guide Robin and he even gave my son a pack of Vietnamese Coffee. Alex gave my son a wooden beads bracelet, they were so thoughtful. 😊

By the way, the tour guides are for free, but you can give gifts or tip, we packed a gift for each student and gave them tips because they deserved it. You need to pay the entrance fee of Museums or other sites that requires entrance fee payment and for every food that you ordered. We really don't mind paying for these things because the students gave their time to accomodate us.

I joined them twice for the food tour at night and for the day tour the next day. Both were great experiences. Linh and Đức are experienced guides, that have loads of info about the local culture, foods and places to share. Their English was very good and is was also great to get some insights on the upcoming Tet holiday. Plus they were able to engage the guests in their authentic own ways. HFWT was also very flexible when I booked the day tour as they were willing to give a private tour. So I can definitely recommend them.

I used hanoi's free walking tour 4 times on my recent trip.  They were all so very friendly.  we had 2 group trips and 2 solo trips.  The one on one trips was good as i felt i had my own personal friend in Hanoi to show me their city.

Special shout out to  Lynn, Khai, Phoebe May and not forgetting Minh.

Even if it states its a FREE walking tour, i practice to give at least US$5 to help them cover their time and transport.  Its a small price to pay, so lets not get cheap on them, they really do an amazing job at making us feel at home! Strongly recommended to anyone that goes to Hanoi.

We booked two tours with Hanoi free tours. On the first one - the street food of Hanoi, spent a brilliant evening with our student guide Yen.She not only showed us how and where and what food to eat in the old quarter but we also learnt about her family and her culture. All for about 500000d.

On the second morning we met up with Mai, and had and equally fascinating historical tour of the old quarter including the White horse temple, the oldest temple in Hanoi.

We really loved meeting both of these lovely ladies and getting to know a bit more about Hanoi but even more about their lives. Thank you Mai and Yen.

Fantastic tour through the city! Truly free, our amazing tour guide didn't want to accept tips. Book in advance and don't show up without booking. Bring water, sunscreen, an umbrella if you can, and something to cover your shoulders and knees.

data.formatted_address: 4th Floor, 41 P. Lương Văn Can, Hàng Gai, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: HA Food Tours

reviews.text: I absolutely adored our food tour with Jenny, what a perfect way to experience food in Hanoi. Jenny was engaging, funny and had a lot of interesting knowledge about the food and local area. Even after the tour, she had additional recommendations for our group. The group size was also great and allowed us to get to know some other people in Hanoi. Would definitely suggest doing this experience at the start of your trip in Hanoi!

This was wonderful, my 12 yr old couldn’t stop eating! This was the best way to see the old quarter of Hanoi. We had Jenny from the Block as our guide and she provided an informative and personal journey through 7 courses of delicious north Vietnamese cuisine. If you have time I cannot recommend this highly enough. We got everything from beef salad to rolls to skewers to pho to egg coffee (yes it’s a thing). I recommend a siesta post completion. Five stars, would do again!

Our Small Group Hanoi Street Food Tour with a Real Foodie was an unforgettable culinary journey through the heart of Hanoi. This tour is a must for any food lover looking to explore the authentic flavours of Vietnamese cuisine.

Guide:
Our guide was fantastic. She was friendly, approachable, and ensured everyone in the group had a great time. Her insights into the local food culture added a special touch to the experience.

Food:
The variety and quality of the food we tried were outstanding. From the iconic pho and banh mi to lesser-known local delicacies, every dish was a delight. We visited several street vendors and small eateries, each offering a unique and delicious taste of Hanoi. The food was fresh, flavourful, and authentic.

Experience:
The small group size made the tour feel intimate and personalised. It was easy to interact with the guide, making the experience more enjoyable. Walking through the bustling streets of Hanoi, discovering hidden food gems, and learning about the history and preparation of each dish was fascinating.

Highlights:
-The guide’s storytelling and personal anecdotes about each food stop.
-Trying dishes and eating at places we might not have discovered on our own.
- Learning about the ingredients and techniques that make Vietnamese cuisine so special.
-The opportunity to see and experience local markets and food stalls up close.

Value:
The tour was excellent value for money. We sampled a wide range of dishes, each portioned perfectly to allow us to enjoy multiple tastings without feeling too full. The knowledge and expertise of the guide added immense value to the overall experience.

Overall Experience:
Our Small Group Hanoi Street Food Tour with a Real Foodie was a highlight of our trip to Hanoi. It was an excellent way to explore the city’s culinary landscape and learn about its rich food culture. We left the tour with full stomachs and a deeper appreciation for Vietnamese cuisine. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Hanoi!

We had an incredible private food tour with Jenny. She was so knowledgeable, engaging, and had a great sense of humor! She took us to incredible places but also tailored the tour to our specific likes and preferences. She followed up with more food recommendations for our week long stay in Hanoi! Get Jenny as your guide. She is 10 stars all the way! Thank you, “Jenny from the Block!”

Our food tour with Jenny was awesome! She totally got us and tailored the tour to our tastes. From rolling our own summer rolls to slurping pho, every bite was a winner. Jenny's stories about the dishes' origins added a cool layer to the experience. Plus, she taught us some Vietnamese words so we could chat with locals. We met some cool people along the way too. If you're a true foodie, Jenny's tours are a no-brainer!

data.formatted_address: P. Hàng Da, Cửa Đông, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Hang Da Market

reviews.text:
Let's shop! Hanoi.
Bat Trang Village Ceramics via Hang Da Market, Hoan Kiem. Traditional pottery since c14.
Supporting local industry ... they saw us coming! Handmade mixed 'set'.

This is a market you find in the basement next to the parking deck. If you ask for what you look like. They will show you the whole place. A new way of shopping 😁. This cooler than outside but the air quality 😀

DO NOT GO HERE! This is nolonger a working mall, there are no shops anymore let alone lights or aircon/fans operating. We walked up every floor, the esculator are not running. The are only 2 things operating there now. A gym or fitness centre and a childcare centre. Nothing else. Dont waste time, long dead mall.
This used to be a nice mall but as others said it is now a daycare on the second floor. A gym above that and not much else.  If you are a tourist there isn’t anything here that would appeal to you.

Inside of the mall: it’s okay. They have been renovating it constantly these past few years. Come during daytime - business hours to check out small stalls on the first floor (overpriced). 2nd floor has a good internet cafe with high-spec computers for gaming or working. Top floor is california gym - overpriced gym with invasive PTs (will interrupt your workout to criticize your form to get you to buy their PT service) and invasive sales people (once they have your phone number they will call you to get you to pay more almost every single day without fail).

What really pisses me off is the motorbike parking downstairs. Overpriced, 5k for a few hours and up to 8-15k for longer. There’s no roof (at that price??) over your motorbikes so the sun and rain can have at it. The “guards” are rude, uneducated, will shout at you like they own the place, and lazy - you won’t see them help you park your motorbike. They prefer to sit still under the umbrella chit chatting, eating and drinking all day. Are they not paying them enough for charging that ridiculous parking price or what??

data.formatted_address: 7 Đ. Thanh Niên, Trúc Bạch, Ba Đình, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: John McCain Memorial

reviews.text: As an American it's a pretty cool.  The location is amazing I was hanging out and talking to a local he told me Joe Biden had just been there 2 months ago.   I would say it's more of a memorial to the people that caught John McCain as he's not depicted very well with his hands up and his head down.  Going to post a full video on YouTube

A monument to commemorate the historical event in Vietnam. The monument is built at the lakeside where it is believed as the location where the event was happened. You need to really pay attention upon passing through or else you would not recognize it. The event was explained in Vietnamese only.

This is an unexpected Monument to an American hero. Unassuming and slightly reserved much like the man himself. I recommend you pay a visit and then head over to the crashed B-52 for a nice walking tour.
Monument showing where John McCain got shot down at Tay Ho and captured in the war. Think it's actually a monument to the people who captured him rather than to him
Monument to John Mccain. It's in vietnamese, and if you don't pay attention, you'll just pass by it.

data.formatted_address: 12 P. Lê Lai, Lý Thái Tổ, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Emperor Ly Thai To Monument Statue

reviews.text: Didn’t read much about the history of this site prior to my visitation. Apparently, emperor Ly was the founding member of the Ly dynasty. I found the history very similar to the Chinese one. Anyway, the place was well kept and we took some pictures there. Think only need to spend around 15 minutes and it was located very close to the lake. Maybe reading up a bit of its history will make it a more interesting place to visit.
If you’re a history person, account for at least 2.5 hours. Lots to read and see around the Imperial Palace. If you go during the summer, God speed.

The Emperor Ly Thai To Monument in Hanoi is a truly imposing bronze statue that commands attention. This magnificent monument is a tribute to history and culture, and it stands tall and proud in the heart of the city.

What sets this monument apart is not only its historical significance but also the meticulous upkeep of the surrounding area. The square where it resides is exceptionally clean and well-maintained, providing a peaceful oasis amidst the bustling city. It's a great place to take a leisurely stroll, snap some photos, or simply reflect on the rich history it represents.

Visiting the Emperor Ly Thai To Monument is not just an opportunity to appreciate the artistry of the statue but also a chance to soak in the tranquil atmosphere of this well-maintained public space. Highly recommended for history enthusiasts and anyone looking for a peaceful respite in Hanoi.

The Emperor Ly Thai To Monument in Hanoi is a beautiful cultural and historical architectural structure located in the heart of the city, offering a direct view of Hoan Kiem Lake. Standing at approximately 10 meters tall, adorned with intricate and detailed sculptures, it serves as a magnificent symbol of Hanoi's thousand-year history.

The surrounding area is spacious, clean, and refreshing, adorned with numerous green trees planted on both sides and a wide open courtyard at the back. People often come here for sightseeing or exercise, enjoying a leisurely walk around the monument.

If you're touring Hanoi, passing through the Old Quarter, taking a moment to visit this monument is worthwhile. It not only provides an opportunity to delve into history but also offers a chance to experience something new amidst the bustling city.
Statue located near Hoan Kiem Lake. Very vibrant surrounding by the lush trees.

reviews.text: Bac Son Monument is a war memorial monument to commemorate the heroes and  martyrs who sacrificed for freedom and independence of the country. It can be viewed from Bac Son Street, opposite the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, next to Thang Long Royal Citadel and Ba Dinh Square. No entrance is allowed to the war monument. Visitors may only view from the gate or take picture there.
Decent road for walking with some Sightseeing

This is ridiculously! So a baby under 2 years old is not allowed to enter for what reason? What the heck is this ? I have attached the picture of the regulations at the entrance of the Mausoleum and there is nothing saying that! So I have spend 1 hour waiting my city tour for this stupidity! I would no recommend visit that the security were very unfriendly saying baby not cannot wall? What does this means ? You are working in a mausoleum and is unable to speak international language English ? What the heck !!!! Families do give a try to this thing it’s a complete waste of times ! Cheers!
Cant go close to the statuę but its looks nice :)
Can't get close to it. Always soldiers guarding it. It is exactly in straight line with the Ho Chi Minh mausoleum and behind three parliament building.

data.formatted_address: 23 P. Mạc Đĩnh Chi, Trúc Bạch, Ba Đình, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Hanoi Studio Gallery

reviews.text:
Hanoi Studio is always one of my favorite galleries in Hanoi whenever I have the opportunity to visit home.  In particular, I am really impressed and excited with the current new facility.  This is an exhibition space with a very suitable and delicate arrangement of paintings and lighting!  Indeed, this is a destination worth visiting for those who love to feel art!  I had an experience of enjoying the exhibition in the deepest and most pleasant way, because not only the open space inside, but also the idyllic scenery of the alley outside ❤️❤️❤️ Always my fav❤️❤️❤️
P/s: Here you have a view of the lake and such a beautiful sunset!  And the staff is very friendly to guide and answer all my requests!

As art lover I was super happy to walk by this place by accident. Amazing pieces. I was and still am thankful for the knowledgeable staff that gave me heaps of insights. In case you see the statue of the water buffalo while you are there - get the insights of it - just a mind blowing piece of art. Thanks to the artists and the kind staff.
Ok, don’t know how we ended up here but this is a great stop to enjoy some local art, try the local Vietnamese coffee, and get to see the sunset if you’re lucky and there are not many clouds.

Best gallery I can found in Hanoi! Delicate open space inside with a wonderful view all around. Even if it's challenging to find the location, the staffs is so nice! Highly recommended and definitely comeback here!

One of the best private gallery in Hanoi.  There are top vietnames artists and High quality exhibition space.
The owner has very interesting point of view about contemporary art. It seems like that very important art space for the future.

data.formatted_address: 66 P. Nguyễn Thái Học, Điện Biên, Ba Đình, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Vietnam National Fine Arts Museum

reviews.text: The building has a French colonial architecture and the ticket to enter is very cheap something like 1.50$. The museum has some nice artifacts and antiques mainly from the recent years. A very big section is dedicated to the civil war. A lot of student are in the museum creating there own work. Generally it’s a nice experience for the whole family.

Great place to spend 1-2 hours. Well appointed museum and there was barely anyone when I visited on a weekday afternoon. My favourite section was the wood lacquered paintings that are so unique and incredibly impressive.

I definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to learn more about Vietnamese culture. The museum displays art and sculptures that represent Vietnamese history through different eras, from the very beginning to wars to the present.
You should rent an audio guide to learn more about each artwork or go with a Vietnamese friend to hear the stories behind these artworks.
And You definitely should view “Son mai” paintings (tranh sơn mài), they are magnificent. I’m a huge fan of this type of paintings.
Ticket’s price for an adult is 40K VND.

If you want to learn about Vietnamese culture, this is a place you shouldn't miss. The museum exudes a sense of antiquity, with many precious artifacts inside representing Vietnam's long history.

The ticket price is 40,000 VND for adults. If you purchase a ticket with audio narration, it will be around 115,000 VND (I don't remember exactly because I bought a regular ticket).

You can explore the entire museum, including any temporary exhibitions taking place at the time. The museum consists of 3 floors and a basement area.

The content from the 1st to the 3rd floor of the museum will span the length of Vietnam's history and culture, from prehistoric times to the present day.
Floors 1-2 primarily introduce relics and architecture from ancient times.
From the 3rd floor, contemporary paintings and famous sculptures of Vietnam will be displayed.
The basement is where ceramics are exhibited. Due to the low ceiling in the basement, people over 1.8 meters tall may have difficulty exploring.

Vietnam National Fine Arts Museum is a cannot-be-missed destination for visitors and art lovers. The place serves as a showcase for over 18,000 artifacts, including 2,000 permanent exhibits, distinctively representing the rich cultural and artistic history of Vietnam. The museum is proudly the venue for preseving and displaying 09 national treasures, as listed:

- The Statue of Avalokiteshvara Buddha
- The Statue of Empress Trinh Thi Ngoc Truc
- Doors carved with Dragons
- The lacquer painting “Standing Screen”
- The painting “Litte Thuy”
- The painting “Two Maidens and a Little Boy”
- The painting “Party Admission Ceremony at Dien Bien Phu”
- The painting “Bac Ho at Viet Bac War Zone”
- The painting “Giong”

Vietnam National Fine Arts Museum encompasses 03 floors.

The first floor serves as the venue that showcases the artistic works from Prehistoric, from the 11th century to the 14th century (Ly Dynasty - Tran Dynasty), from the 15th century to 17th century (Le So - Mac - Le Trung Hung Dynasty), from the 18th century to 19 century.

The second floor is dedicated to the representatives of near-modern times until 1945, art in the resistance period, and lacquer painting.

The third floor invites visitors to embrace the art of silk paintings, Vietnamese paper paintings, and oil paintings.

The ticket price ranges from 10.000 (for kids from 6 years old to 16 years old) to 40.000 VND (for adults), and the additional service of Smart Guide (with the audible tour guide) at the price of 50.000 VND. Strolling through floors and rooms, ancient artifacts that are meticulously crafted, created, and painted by artisans offer a delightful and nostalgic experience. Heritage arts may be static beings, but they have stood the test of time, retaining the tranquil presence that evokes our emotions and regret for once-golden times.

data.formatted_address: 50 P. Đào Duy Từ, Hàng Buồm, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Cultural Exchange Center

reviews.text: I thought this place was closed when I arrived, dark and empty on the ground floor, one guy asleep in a chair. I think, reading other reviews, that this is only partially open. I wandered upstairs to find some interesting black & white photos taken in the late 1800's of early Hanoi. There is also information on the progression of the French colonisation of IndoChina. I guess the guy downstairs woke up whilst I was upstairs as he put the lights on.

Loved this place. I’d say it’s a must visit if you’re gorging on the old quarter. Really gives a perspective about the rich history of the land. Liked that they bring emphasis on sustainability and how to preserve the heritage with all the commercial explosion now.

A place to see contemporary art - traditional art and to understand more about the culture of Vietnam.  When I arrived, the second floor display area was still unfinished. But it's a place that I highly recommend you visit.
Registration venue for Asia link Sketchwalk. Well designed and planned to accommodate all of the delegates - double heights enhance the beauty.
Needs a sign to be more visible, but otherwise a fantastic place to learn about the history of the Old Quarters and other exhibitions

data.formatted_address: 26 P. Hàng Bè, Hàng Bạc, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Văn Tribal Art

reviews.text:
Authentic items, great range of items for all interested buyers of different budgets.  The owner and her niece speak good English, especially her niece.

The woman who owns it seems to have cultivated a strong relationship with different regions and villages all over Vietnam — her items are beautiful and old.   An amazing array of items from shamans, ceremonies, and weddings.  Newer replicas from local artists as well as older items — paintings, fabrics, jewelry.  Highly, highly recommend

Văn Tribal Art is an amazing store! I bought a beautiful hand crafted bracelet while I was in Hanoi, and was able to ship a bag that I wasn’t able to buy in person to Saigon a week later. Very sweet and helpful staff, with a wide range of interesting and unique items. Definitely check this shop out! Wonderful for gifts too 🌼 thank you again !

I visited this antique art shop during a business trip about a month ago and all I can say is wow ! This place is awesome. I met a young woman and her aunt Minh (I think that was her name) and they were extremely welcoming and helpful. I was interested in bring back something home that was unique and not the touristy mass produced junk that you can find anywhere. I ended up purchasing an antique priest mask and a wooden carving of a "dog-dragon." The owners even explained to me the meaning behind each item and provided me a nice short history lesson. I HIGHLY recommend this place if you want to bring back something unique and meaningful and if you like antique art in general. I definitely will come back !

The stuff in the store is beautiful! I was going to buy something, but the lady with tattoo in the store has so much attitude as if I was bothering her. And it’s so obvious on her face that I can’t convince myself to buy anything. She basically sighed in front of my face when I asked questions. I don’t know if it’s the language that she doesn’t know how to express in English or something else. Not pleasant.  If you don’t want business, fine! As you wish!

A treasure trove of gorgeous and unique old stuff. We bought a few cushion covers, a bag made of vintage Hmong (I think) cloth and a new but unusually lovely woven scarf. We didn't find another shop like it in Vietnam.

data.formatted_address: 2 Ng. 31 P. Hoàng Cầu, Chợ Dừa, Đống Đa, Hà Nội, Vietnam

reviews.text:
Menu is quite limited!
Atmosphere is pretty good, suitable for group gatherings
However, drinks are not ok at all!
They do have parking lot!
Not too crowded. Not too impressive dishes. Popular beers. Beauty place.

The food are normally cooked. The menu is familiar but there's no specific or particular dishes. However, the environment and atmosphere of the restaurant are very nice. Some warm corners and tables, with flowers and lanterns to make them cozy and sweet.

Good for big group gatherings, cute friendly staff, nice decoration, especialy the garden looks nice and would be a perfect spot in the summer. The food is specially decorated for restaurant thus the price is rather expensive. Toilet is clean, guards are polite and helpful. Overall quite an experience but not your daily meal.

Joined a birthday party here, you can have private place for up to 15-20 people and there still plenty of space left.
Love the food, they were all well-made in my opinion

Specialty Plant Nursery Area BOI DIEN

If you ask where is Hanoi the greenest? So this is it. Coming here is like being a century away from the outside with 20 hectares of preserved forest. The lungs of Hanoi. There is a concrete road that goes around for about 2km. Lots of birds. And there is a small island in the middle of the lake. Here they maintain the status quo. Don't cut the grass so it grows naturally. Cool green space. If you know the staff there, you can ask to come in and take a look around. Always high. Like a miniature forest.
Many trees, cool

So cute
Ok
Perfect

data.formatted_address: Hồ Sơn, Tam Đảo District, Vĩnh Phúc, Vietnam
data.name: Tam Dao Bear Rescue Center

reviews.text:
Make a reservation! Had a lovely time. Kid friendly. Very knowledge staff and lots of bears to take a look at. Tour can be in Vietnamese or English. Tour lasts about an hour and fifteen minutes to an hour and a half.

Good to see the conservation efforts as well as the common reasons for saving the bears. They also help educating people on replacements for bear products.

Happy looking bears in a safe place, hopefully they all get well soon and return to the wild.
Thank you all of the staff for your amazing work

This is a rescue centre. Animals Asia is stopping bear bile farming in Vietnam. The bears come here to live out their lives peacefully. This is not a zoo,  you must book online for a tour on their open days.
It's a very educational place. I recommend knowing the place's meaning.
The staff were friendly and its a really worth while program. I had to physically restrain myself from cuddling the bears

data.formatted_address: Sông Quy Xuân, Đàm Thủy, Trùng Khánh District, Cao Bang, Vietnam
data.name: Ban Gioc Waterfalls

reviews.text:
This place has real natural beauty as Cascades of waterfalls fall down a good 20 m
It’s geographically very interesting because it is China on one side of the river and Vietnam on the lower side.
The Vietnam side is randomly undeveloped
You can get a boat up closer to the main falls if you wish
There is a lot of spray and sunset is a good time to do this activity
Maybe afterwards get a snack or a drink at one of the mini stores
I think this is a must do if you are in North Vietnam
Great weather, especially in winter. Check out if it rain or not before come here. Plus ticket are free if you go in 4~5am in the morning

40k entrance fee, then a further 50k if you want to take the boat closer to the waterfall. I chose to take the boat and enjoyed it very much, you do get wet with all the spray from the waterfall! It is very touristy but that’s to be expected, I was the only westerner there though at the time so expect people to stare a little😅 Lots of motorbike parking and there’s toilets and lots of nearby stalls selling souvenirs (no food that I can remember). The area is beautiful overall!
I liked it but clearly not as good as the photos from a drone would have looked better from The Chinese side as thay have the viewing bridge which I think you can get to

The waterfall is beautiful and majestic, the natural scenery is like a fairyland.

reviews.text:
Quite a beautiful lake that has its beauty both in day time as well as nighttime. Loved the overall vibe here with people sitting to take a break from all the chaos.

Best thing hang around a nice cafe overlooking this cafe and enjoy.
Great atmosphere. It was quite nice to walk around the lake during sunset, sipping peach lemon iced tea. Quite lively place at all times of the day.

Lovely little spot to walk around, lots of artists along the walk drawing portraits and it’s great fun trying to spot turtles popping their heads up in the water. To walk across the bridge and walk around the temple it costs 50.000 dong each. Temple is small but very pretty it wasn’t over crowded which was a nice surprise.

We enjoyed our walk around this lake.
Lots of locals and tourists enjoying the walkways and scenery.
It's a pleasant change to have paths where there are no motorbikes, which makes it a safe place for families.

A lively place in the middle of old quarter. You can see many local people praying/doing meditation towards the lake, doing sports and dancing in the park and walking freely when the traffic is closed.

data.formatted_address: 88 Bùi Thị Xuân, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Hanoi Club

reviews.text: Surprisingly the best hotel i’ve stayed with this price range. The staff was very helpful and super friendly. The two bellboys i met were also very nice. So are the pool and the golf range. If there were room for improvement, you could maybe make it clear about the opening time of the pool, either on the website or on site. I was quite confused about the closing time.

Tried their golf range. Had to buy a ticket at reception then pick up the balls in the store next door. There’s no staff so you have to carry your own clubs and bring your own tee. Lake view is very chill, especially for sun set. Food was pretty good but serving time was long.
Decent of decent! I highly recommend their Oriental dishes that wouldn't disappoint you.

Yall, this is the best hotel ever! My friend and I asked for the stars and they delivered. All the staff speak great English and help you with everything you need. The amenities were 5 star. Golfing driving range into the lake was 1st class, the pool, and they even have a casino for foreigners (which we walked with money!) Highly recommend.
Went for the pool, ended up using the gym which is quite good. It seems to be a social club where locals bring their kids for swimming and golf lessons.

data.formatted_address: Ba Vì, Hanoi, Vietnam
data.name: Ba Vi National Park

reviews.text: The road access to the National Park is under construction, but if you go at lunchtime, when all the workers are eating or sleeping, there will be no delays. Beautiful place, I went there to get off the beaten track and not have to hear motorcycles and cars driving and Honking. ( it’s about an hour away from Hanoi. )

We had up-and-down emotion to get to the Bavi National Park and I will summarize as belows:
- Up to the elevation 400m, road is terrible due to road maintenance. We had to wait for 10 min for a concrete truck to work across the road. It is so crowded and dusty without any warning in the beginning of the road.
- From elevation 400m to 700m, a quite good road to go will full of plants around.
- From elevation 700m to 1100m, a high slope can make your brake broken down when going down. Be careful with this popular problem there. We also made that similar difficulty and a little bit scary to go down.
On the cote 1100, it is so special to see the fog and clouds going around. A good moment to enjoy the travel.
Note that you will buy a ticket at the foot of the park, vnd 60k per person excluded your vehicle fee.

Lưu ý rất dễ mất phanh khi đi xuống từ cao độ 1100m đến 700m vì đường rất dốc. Nên chuẩn bị sẵn số điện thoại trong trường hợp cần cứu hộ xe.

I did a solo bike trip up here after my HaGiang loop of 11days. Paid entrance fee, early morning ride up the misty, nature filled, fresh air....I was filled with excitement. Did not see any visitors along the way, except for a young local couple on a motorbike.
Saw a deserted Catholic Church, some bungalows for rent and trees.
Had an eerie encounter near a large stone boulder, felt someone's watching me, when my bike suddenly stop. Unable to start.
Long story short, I rolled down the hill for about 1-2km before I was to start my bike and left the place.
It's a very spiritual area.

Took a taxi, and he stopped where we wanted along the road towards the peak of the mountain. At the top of the road, he parked, and we walked up the stairs to the left and saw two buildings/ pagodas/ temples that were amazing and an incredible view. The walk/ hike took about an hour or so (2.5km up and down) , and it's upstairs, so be prepared.

Total time was about 3 hours.
A great location to do picnic, not too far from Hanoi center

data.formatted_address: 1 Tràng Tiền, Phan Chu Trinh, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Bảo tàng Lịch sử Quốc gia

reviews.text:
The interior design of the is not too crowded, the temperature is comfortable and the appearance of the museum is impressive. The presentation of exhibition is quite traditional. However, the the caption of the some artifacts are too simple.

Besides, the offical website shows that it needs to have extra tickets for taking photos, but the staff said that no extra fee for phototaking. The information in the website is not updated.

Entrance tickets apply to two visiting areas of the museum. The showroom is invested quite eye-catchingly with good lighting (the remaining area should be renovated because there are a few showrooms with no or broken lighting...). A place to visit to learn about history and it is located right next to the old town center behind the opera house.
The ticket is pricey 40.000 VND, and the collection of the museum is average. But it still quite interested in to learn about Hanoi history. Some places don’t have AC

Open till 5pm, tickets 300k, cash only...there are many atms in the vicinity...the museum is a must visit with a pleasant experience and a well cataloged journey into Vietnamese history, origins and imperial times...they have a great collection of artifacts including a Mummy on display...

Stepping into the Vietnam National Museum of History, I embarked on a journey through the rich tapestry of Vietnam's past. Each exhibit, meticulously curated and thoughtfully presented, offered a glimpse into the nation's storied history and cultural heritage.

As I wandered through the halls, I was struck by the resilience and strength of the Vietnamese people in the face of adversity. From the struggles against foreign colonization to the trials of war and conflict, the museum's exhibits illuminated the triumphs and tribulations of generations past.

One exhibit, in particular, left a profound impact on me. It chronicled the human cost of war, showcasing artifacts and personal stories that spoke to the courage and sacrifice of those who fought and perished in defense of their homeland. Standing before the relics of a bygone era, I was overwhelmed by a wave of emotion, my heart heavy with sorrow for the lives lost and the suffering endured.

Yet, amidst the darkness of war and conflict, there were also moments of hope and resilience. Another exhibit celebrated the vibrant cultural heritage of Vietnam, showcasing traditional arts, crafts, and customs passed down through generations. Here, I found solace in the beauty and richness of the country's cultural legacy, a testament to the enduring spirit of the Vietnamese people.

Leaving the museum, I couldn't shake the weight of the experience from my mind. It was a poignant reminder of the fragility of peace and the resilience of the human spirit. But above all, it was a call to action, urging me to remember the lessons of the past and strive for a future of peace, understanding, and reconciliation.

data.formatted_address: 1 P. Hoả Lò, Trần Hưng Đạo, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Hoa Lo Prison Relic

reviews.text:
The political history of Vietnam is wonderfully retold by Hoa Lo Prison Memorial. I very much recommend visiting if you want to learn more about Vietnam, and get the audio guide!! That way, you can take your time understanding each exhibit. The audio guide here is of good quality, and worth it. It gives a more immersive experience.

You can really feel the patriotism of the revolutionists from the prison, who still managed to educate themselves and fight for their rights within the confines of the prison, despite the inhumane treatment. My favorite part was the story of their escape, but you better go visit so you can hear it for yourself. 😉

Note: Lots of walking and some stairs, but there are many seats available where you can rest. There are vending machines inside, but I recommend bringing your own water canteen.

This place is definitely worth visiting. It’s always good to see some of the history of places we visit. Some exhibits could be a little disturbing but overall, it’s a must see venue.

Please bring local currency though. We made the mistake thinking they will take digital payment or USD. Good thing is, there is a bank around the corner at the Hanoi Tower!

Many tourists visit here but it was not too overcrowded. I recommend paying for the audio guide which includes commentary from actual inmates and P.O.W, giving so much more context and meaning to our visit. The conditions must have been extremely harrowing and yet the Vietnamese spirit remained strong and resolute. I felt great empathy for those who would have suffered here.

What an awful place to be locked up..i was already stuggling with the 30+ heat/humidity.. so to consider sharing a space with 100 or more people would have been horrific.. I enjoyed visiting the museum to learn more about the push for independence by political prisioners, and the daring escapes from inside too.
Fees: 50,000 entrance fee, and if you'd like to hear the audio version - that's an extra 100,000. There were more stories on the audio version that written/posted with the displays.
There are upstairs/downstairs displays. There were a few bathrooms.. umbrellas to borrow between storms. There was also a vending machine, and some tourist items for sales too.

Visiting the this prison was a deeply moving experience that left a lasting impression on me. Known as the "Hanoi Hilton" during the Vietnam War, this site is steeped in history and offers a sobering glimpse into the past.

The exhibits are meticulously curated, providing a comprehensive narrative of the prison's history from its construction by the French colonists to its use during the Vietnam War. Walking through the narrow corridors and dimly lit cells, I could almost feel the weight of the stories held within these walls. (Yes - get the audioguide...it is Sooo worth it)  The personal accounts, photographs, and artifacts brought the history to life in a way that was both educational and emotional.

One of the most poignant sections of the museum is dedicated to the American POWs who were held here. The exhibits do an excellent job of conveying the harsh realities they faced, as well as the resilience and camaraderie that helped them endure. It’s a stark reminder of the human spirit’s capacity to withstand even the most challenging circumstances.

What struck me most was the contrast between the prison's grim past and the bustling, vibrant city that surrounds it today. It’s a powerful testament to the passage of time and the progress that has been made. This place is not just a museum; it’s a place of reflection and remembrance, offering valuable lessons about history, resilience, and the importance of peace.

If you’re in Hanoi, I highly recommend a visit. It’s a profound journey through history that will leave you with a deeper understanding of Vietnam’s past and a greater appreciation for the present.

data.formatted_address: 28A Điện Biên Phủ, Điện Biên, Ba Đình, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Vietnam Military History Museum

reviews.text:
This museum has a lot of information and items, I spent around 2 hours walking around and reading everything - Very cool stuff.

Bear in mind that the tanks, helicopters and planes have been relocated to another museum (they did not have the location named) so they are no longer here.

If you could let us know where the items are being relocated to that would be great

That was a bit of a let down as I really wanted to see them - The large Hellcat wreckage is still there though and there is plenty of weaponry and other items used located inside.

Worst museum. It has just a couple of pistols, knifes and spears. The rest are just photographs and war stories. All of the planes, tanks and most of the good stuff has been relocated to another museum that’s not open. Definitely not recommended unless you want to see the flag tower which is nice. Also tickets are cheap but not worth it.

Don’t go if you’re looking to see the planes, tanks, choppers and other heavy equipment. They’re not there anymore.
It seems there is a new museum being built somewhere where they will all go and all that equipment has been stored in the mean time. Information was hard to gather, but that’s what I have. The remaining small items clothes, firearms, etc are okay. The flag tower is cool. And the rubble of ex-planes is artistic in a eashhh kind of way. It’s hard to complain for 30,000 dong. But unless you haven’t been to other war museums in SE Asia, it’s not overly different. Although Vietnam history buffs may like it, but be prepared for….slight to not slight propaganda, biased signage and displays set up by people who may not have actual military experience 😁, no matter what you think of the war itself. But it’s all part of the experience I guess.
The morale of the story is, don’t take your 5 year old boy whom you’ve been promising tanks and planes for a week. Quite sad, plus he had trouble understanding how they even got the tanks out since they’re so heavy!🤣

Unfortunately, when I initially visited the museum, it was closed. However, I made sure to plan my visit again for the following day.

The museum showcases an impressive level of detail with a wide range of exhibitions, including weapons and photographs. If you have an interest in gaining a deeper understanding of history, I would recommend allocating around 1-1.5 hours for your visit.

On a less positive note, I encountered an issue with the security guard at the entrance. Upon stepping in and taking a quick look around for just a few seconds, the guard shouted at me in a loud and rude manner, insisting that I purchase a ticket. It would have been appreciated if he had approached the situation with a calmer demeanor. After all, I was there to enjoy my visit and relax in the city. It's important to remember that as a visitor, I don't work for the museum or the guard. Nonetheless, I found the situation somewhat amusing and shared a lighthearted response with him.

Despite the encounter with the security guard, the military museum itself offers a valuable experience, providing in-depth insights into history. I hope my review helps others plan their visit accordingly.

Some exhibits were eye opening, but mostly underwhelming. Thought I was going to see some tanks and walk in fox holes or trenches. But there wasn't any exhibits to I tract with. It's a lot of reading small texts and looking at artifacts (if they have it). Cool sculptures and fascinating exhibits, just wish there was more things to interact with and a souvenir shop to at least get some books.

data.formatted_address: 1-8 P. Lê Thái Tổ, Hàng Trống, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Hoan Kiem Lake

reviews.text:
I really like this lake, it made for a very enjoyable morning having a walk around it. I'd recommend on a weekend for sure since they close the roads around it off from cars.. with traffic the experience would be totally shot.

Fun little stores and shops along the walk, and some good people watching as well. The trees overhanging the lake are super photogenic as well.

Heading back to Hanoi soon and will take a jaunt around the lake again

The most iconic landmark of Hanoi. It is a wonderful place to go for a stroll and just relax. The weekends are particularly nice since there are some performers and some exhibitions or events. The fireworks foe NYE happen here, too. What a wonderful place.

Visited here on a weekend on a family vacation, lovely place, cool breeze, nice view. The entire Block was closed off by the local government for tourist to walk every weekend. Definite recommendation to visit here when you are in hanoi . It is also the first top on the hop on and hop off bus tour.

I got an Airbnb right across the lake for a couple nights. Morning walks was nice. Daytime was way too hot. At night is when the locals start to flock in. The lake life is bustling!  From couples, to families to tourists. Can get quite loud from the music blasting but it’s definitely an experience to be had.

As far as lakes go this one is pretty below average. You cant go swimming in it, You cant rent a paddle boat to go row around in it, all you can do is walk around it. The only saving grace of the lake is the pagoda.

reviews.text: Completely empty , not a lot of Explanations, there are some, but even after reading it, you won’t be sure of what you’re supposed to get from the explanation. There is a small museum with no air-conditioning that you can see pieces of pottery found from the wells. It’s a big archaeological area from a very long time ago. You can see everything in 10 or 15 minutes.

Worth visiting. Included on the ticket for Thang Long citadel but very few seems to visit. Because of the rain some areas are covered with tarps to protect from water splashes and leaking roof- in some areas you can only see tarps-ground covered in tarps. Has a nice museum with some of their significant finds within the area. A working archaeological site- you can see people within the site doing stuffs. Has a nice coffee shop
Walk on the back of the building where the coffee shop is and find the garden with beautiful small bonsai trees, it's really amazing

Good vibes, good coffee with acceptable price !
Can take around to see Imperial Citadel of Thang Long
Take a break when visiting the citadel in this cool little cafe. Good coffee, chilled vibe. Recommend the Summer Breeze - made with espresso and soda.

data.formatted_address: 4GQ3+GM9, Hoàng Diệu, P. Quang Trung, Sơn Tây, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Sơn Tây Old Fortress

reviews.text: It is a relatively large park with full of plants and still keeps ancient traces of the old building and foundation. There are plenty of plants with hundreds of y.o which needs to be more protected and conserved.

Beautiful old fortress, turned into a community park. It has some old war jets and helicopters and it's a great place to jogg or just sit and watch people. Don't forget to visit the temple in the middle and keep and eye out for the trees. They're astounding.

Very nice place and only 45km from Hanoi. No entrance fee just 5000vnd for parking your bike. Its like a relaxing park. Inside the park one old building of the old citadel left with some entrance gates and some ussr aircrafts. Love the old bicycle. It reminds me about my father's bicycle on which he drived me school-home everyday.
Nice little park and fortress to walk around and explore. There were not many people and you just need to pay a little money for parking.

Son tay ancient citadel is located in center of Sơn Tây town which is now a public park for sight seeing, relax. The Citadel has many popular destinations neighborhood such as: Đường Lâm Ancient Village,  Và Temple, Mía Pogoda, Ba Vì National Garden. The Citadel is surrounded by a trench and has four Gate but only one remaining by restructuring. There is a centered temple, a Flag, 2 ponds, and many trees inside. It takes you about one and a half hour from Hà Nội by bus or motorcycle.

reviews.text: The space is large, beautiful and airy.  Enthusiastic and skilled staff.  Delicious food and beautifully presented.  Price is a bit high but reasonable for the quality.  Crowded with locals and tourists.

Staff were plentiful however not overly responsive and continued to try put more plates on a full table. Food was disappointing, the spring rolls had a terrible texture and taste and were not edible. The shrimp rolls were dry and lacked flavor even with sauce. The vegetable noodles and duck rolls were the only thing saving it from a lower score. Unfortunately did not live up to the hype.

Incredible restaurant. Not the ambiance of the streets but more sophisticated. The food is delicious, we tested the roasted duck and the fried buns, the seafood vermicelli and the ribs and we were surprise that they were so good ! Not pricey (unless the alcohol) for the quality!
Recommended 100% but don’t forget to make a reservation.
Also, must be nice to eat in the patio but unfortunately it was raining so we were inside.

We weren't impressed with our visit: the table wasn't very clean, and the food was below average compared to many other restaurants in Hanoi, especially considering this restaurant is on the slightly pricier side. We only tried the chef's selections, but the crab spring rolls were a bit greasy, as was the soft shell crab. The taste of coconut oil was too overpowering. The prawns were somewhat dry, although the sauce served with them was very tasty.
Excellent vietnamese food. Fresh and delicious. Decoration and environment are great even a little bit quarrel.

reviews.text: Great park but currently under renovations. Gonna be even better than before maybe!
A park next to West Lake with busy flows of motorbikes and cars around. Beautiful night views of Hanoi City.

Great park to visit on a nice day. There’s a cool statue in the middle, people playing soccer and exercising, and plenty of park benches to sit on. A good little place right in the bustle of the city.
Nice gardens/park to get out of the rush. Places to walk /sit relax. Small enterance fee

Easy to find, and has tons of open space for workouts or just people watching. This place gets a lot of sunlight and can be super bright in the mornings so it is a great place to enjoy the lake or have a picnic too. There are several bun cha restaurants opposite it. It can get a little manic during rush hours so motorbike parking can be a little complicated but not impossible.

data.formatted_address: 3B P. Chả Cá, Hàng Bồ, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Garden Boutique Hotel & Spa

reviews.text: Came to Vietnam on May 19 and stayed here for 2 days. Staff were friendly and polite. The breakfast buffet was good, not many options, but food was delicious. Room was ok, comfortable bed. The location is perfect, center of old quarter.

The rooms are good and property is clean. We stayed for one night only and do not have many complaints. But there is nothing special about this property.

We couldn't get early check-in, we couldn't get any transportation help, neither any tips or guidance. While we understand that hotels are not responsible for this but all other hotels in Viet Nam made an effort to make things easier for us but this hotel did not. Maybe it's just the other hotels we stayed in were too sweet for us so we expected the same from them and they were just normal.

Great value hotel in a centrally located area of old town in HaNoi. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff were amazing and helped with organising tours and offered competitive exchange rates compared to street vendors. Breakfast buffet was reasonable with enough options for most. Would recommend.

Beautiful hotel in the middle of Hanoi within walking distance of plenty of places of interest, we had a very clean and comfortable room which had a balcony but we didn't use it as it was very cold at the time.
Fantastic staff that treated us very well, we're very helpful and friendly and the breakfast is good with plenty of choices.
The only negative really is sockets are limited, but that's not unusual, and we always carry a multi socket for phones, watches, etc.

We were a group of 6 people, with 3 rooms. There were many disappointing aspects of this place. The rooms we booked were "suites with a view" but my room barely had a window (they said because it was an "upgraded" family suite room 😐). Secondly, my friend got a room with cracked walls (& some water leaks) - the rooms are apparently very old.

On top of that, the services also are not nice. While few staff are polite, others seemed very rude, not willing to help with simple questions & checkout procedures.

The only good part of this hotel is that it's located very near to some popular sites.

data.name: Công Viên Thống Nhất

reviews.text:
Công Viên Thống Nhất is a hidden gem in Hanoi, offering a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Unlike other tourist-packed parks, this serene oasis is frequented by locals, creating an authentic atmosphere.

The park boasts a picturesque lake, lush greenery, and well-maintained walking paths, providing the perfect setting for a leisurely stroll or a peaceful moment of reflection. Families can be seen enjoying picnics, children playing, and couples taking romantic walks.

With plenty of benches and seating areas, it's easy to find a spot to relax and soak in the natural beauty. Whether you're looking to unwind amidst nature or simply observe the local way of life, Công Viên Thống Nhất offers an unforgettable experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking tranquility in the heart of Hanoi.

Beautifull park and big it have many things to see places too sit for all ages and it do feel peacefull in ther i am sure i will go here again in my week of staying in hanoi only thing that bothered me a bit is the toilet ware really disgusting i as a visitor be happy to pay for usage but have it just somewhat clean
Large park that would be great for running if the lake wasn't full of dead fish. The rotten stench is ever present and bathrooms are quite foul.
❤️ Beautiful park ❤️
Not really worth the trek if you're not already in the area

reviews.text: Really enjoyed Skyline Hanoi.. a nice chilled vibed bar with comfortable couch/seating.  Looks to be one of the highest in Hanoi Old Quarters with great 180 degree views. Really nice cocktails at a reasonable price and decent food too. Was staying at Triant Hotel so was our go to for a good, easy option.
We had a lovely time on the roof top . Birthday dinner for 16. Panda our server was very attentive. Amazing
Very good place to spend with love ones. Staff are super friendly. Food was splendid and the atmosphere was even better, especially with the great service.
Amazing 360 views. All the staff including Rusi have been amazing. Great vibe, great cocktails at affordable price and relaxing vibes.
The most beautiful rooftop bar in hanoi. Staff so friendly!

data.formatted_address: 16 Ng. Trung Yên, Hàng Bạc, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Hanoi Skyline Hotel

reviews.text: The service is 5 stars, especially the very helpful and accommodating front office staff, Candy. This is not your usual 3-4 stars hotel. It requires some adaptation to stay here. But location is strategic office the busy streets however it is quiet at night for you to rest well. I stayed in other hotels by the streets, and my sleeping experience then was horrific. So Skyline gives a bit of good mix but not the best best you can expect. But I would recommend this for value for money and short stays, and you do a lot of time outside and not inside the room.

What a brilliant experience. Nothing was too much trouble for either Cindy or Andy and they went above and beyond. The room was also lovely and spotlessly clean - our cleaner was superb too. Great  breakfast, lots of useful and unbiased information.  Would definitely recommend
Location really great, service good. The real downside is that the room was poor quality... bathroom good and clean however. AC noisy and not great and we woke up very tired.
Location is good . just few hundred meters from the Patyu street!  the hotel could be needed for upgrade , otherwise it's clean enough . The reception is super nice and friendly !
Quiet room on a side street.  Great location for walking.  Room 702 has a huge bed and great comfort.  Super hot water.  Breakfast was at a nearby roof-level hotel and was a good value.

data.formatted_address: 54 P. Liễu Giai, Cống Vị, Ba Đình, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: Lotte Observation Deck

reviews.text: Great experience and view of Hanoi. We enjoyed walking around the observatory deck and relaxing overseeing the city at all angles. The Cafe was very good as well. Highly recommend.

If you’re visiting Hanoi, the Lotte Observation Deck is a must-see. From the moment you step into the elevator, the experience is impressive. The staff at the entrance counter are exceptionally friendly and helpful. They assisted us with our tickets and recommended a package that included drinks and a city tour, showcasing their excellent English-speaking skills. The highlight was definitely the observation deck itself. The views of Hanoi and West Lake are simply breathtaking, making it an ideal spot for stunning photographs. We also had the pleasure of trying Bac Xiu coffee, which turned out to be the best coffee we’ve ever had. The barista was incredibly accommodating, adding to the overall delightful experience. In addition to the amazing views and delicious coffee, there are various games to try, making it a fun and interactive visit. The aesthetic appeal and photo opportunities are perfect for capturing unforgettable memories. Highly recommend visiting the Lotte Observation Deck—it’s an experience you won’t want to miss!

Personally, this place is not worth it. The entrance ticket was quite reasonable, and I was able to visit both during the day and at night. It was a lot better during the day, but unfortunately, it was cloudy. I wanted to come back again and check out the view which was extremely disappointing. The inside of the observation deck was bright and light would reflect on the glass making it next to impossible to get a decent view of the city of Hanoi. The staff here are quite rude, and rather seem disinterested to work here. Quite an awful place to visit which is why it has been empty even on a public holiday.

As you can see below, this is an awful place to take pictures. I would recommend you to to avoid this place and save yourself some money.

Had a great time at this spot in Hanoi! They offer motion games and cool photo spots. You can even rent traditional Korean or Vietnamese costumes. The bar is perfect for those looking to chill and enjoy the beautiful Hanoi city view. Highly recommended for a fun and diverse experience!

Overall we are satisfied with the experience. The city views are spectacular. The deck is not crowded at all, nearly empty on either weekends or weekdays. The VR game is fun.

The only drawback is the lack of training and experience of the young staff although they are very friendly and polite to our family. The VR game equipments could have been well-prepared and sanitized instead of making customers wait for 20min to set up.

data.formatted_address: 6 P. Lương Ngọc Quyến, Hàng Buồm, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Hanoi Street View Hotel

reviews.text:
Have never seen such a great hostel. The staff was very friendly and the whole atmosphere was just chilled. The hostel is in the middle of the center and where all the bars are, without having too much noise during the night.
The dorms were clean and big. The beds were much bigger than I'm usually used to in dorms. Just go here and enjoy your stay!

Good small hostel/hotel. Our host TONY arrange our tour to HALONG BAY & it was amazing. The hotel its based right at the center of Hanoi and the street market its just 1 block away from here. Many options from here.
Small rooms but beds are comfortable and there is shower & toilets in the room so no need to share.

Rooms are above the bar (same owner) downstairs which is very loud. The bed sheet and duet is used by the previous guest and they didn't change it for new comers. Our room includes breakfast but it is really inedible  ( fried egg swims in oil, coffee tastes like alcohol from glass they using, knifes and forks are super filthy ) in all, I think it is the same as other low fair accommodation everywhere in this planet.

Worst experience in 3 month travelling. Don't go to this hotel. Four reasons:

- No parking space for motorbikes. Receptionist didn't know where we can park overnight. She sent us to the wrong place and came with a stupid suggestion (park at hospital, Secure? I don't know). We found a place later not far from the hotel...

- Loud music all night from the neighbour bar. Sleep? Not possible...

- Water supply was broken! Receptionist said it will be fixed in an hour. What a lie! We had to buy water bottles to wash our bodies. No further informations when it will be fixed. Edit: Still no water in the morning.

- Wifi isn't working. Bad authorisation with three devices. Edit: Was working in the morning again.

Go somewhere else, there are even cheaper hotels around.

Great place, especially for the price. $5 dorms, but go for the $12 private rooms if you can afford it. They have AC, which helps a lot on Hanoi's humid nights. Located right on the edge of the Old Quarter, it's a great place to party. Bring some earplugs if you're not a night owl!

data.formatted_address: 4 P. Đặng Dung, Quán Thánh, Ba Đình, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Skyline Tower

reviews.text: Stayed with a friend in this Tower for a few days.   The building is in a bustling but much quieter part of Hanoi.   The apartments are spacious and have great balconies overlooking the city.   On a clear day or evening, you can see across the city, if you have a higher floor.   Great service and reception with an adequate gym and a smallish pool.   The bar across the road is very cheap with friendly boys who like to dance for their guests.
I stayed 8 days there , and the view of the west lake was amazing , the room was clean and also spacious. The price was also reasonable. It’s about 20 min walk to old quarter or 7-8 min grab ride
Nice apartment house at the Westlake. Breakfast, pool and gym. Good for long term stay. Very friendly stuff and a good service. 👍
great location, fantastic gym, good staff, amazing views, breakfast is weak, the place is generally quite well run

Skyline Tower is one of the most recommended serviced apartments for foreigners. It is not so luxury building, but apartments are tidy & comfortable with full furniture, very nice view either to the West Lake and Truc Bach Lake or the city. Rental fee is so reasonable and including full services free: internet, cable TV, water, house-keeping including washing clothes and ironing, breakfast also included. Gym and pool are free access.
Skyline Tower has new appearance as it has been renovated recently.

reviews.text:

The location is AWESOME. Close to attractions and close to the nightlife.

reviews.text: What an amazing place. We came for the sunset and the view was amazing. We had 2 cocktails 2 juices and the beef steak with chips veg and egg all were 10000/10. It was perfect for our last night. Such a calm setting. Iris our server was so helpful and kind and we couldn't be happier we would defo recommend.

I had a wonderful birthday celebration at this lovely and cozy place. The ambiance was perfect for an intimate gathering with friends. Special thanks to Iris, one of the restaurant staff, who was incredibly polite and accommodating. Her excellent service made the experience even more enjoyable. Highly recommended!

Such a cozy place to unwind after a long day of walking all over Hanoi old quarter. The staff are also very accommodating and nice.  I enjoyed my Daiquiri :) Highly recommend this place to relax and chill ☺️

My experience at Cloud Sky Bar was phenomenal! The rooftop setting offers breathtaking panoramic views of Hanoi, perfect for a memorable evening. But the true stars of the show were the cocktails. They were incredibly creative and well-crafted, a true delight for my taste buds.

I was equally impressed by the staff. They were incredibly friendly and attentive, always ensuring I had everything I needed. Their service was top-notch, making me feel welcome and comfortable throughout my visit.

Overall, Cloud Sky Bar is a must-visit for anyone seeking a luxurious and enjoyable evening in Hanoi. The combination of stunning views, delicious cocktails, and exceptional service makes it an unforgettable experience.

First time here, so good and the drink was amazing. Iris was taking care of me and my boyfriend. She’s so nice and easy to talk with. Good place, will come back here again if have chance come back to Vietnam!
