data.formatted_address: 44 P. Hồng Tiến, str, Long Biên, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam
data.name: MR LINH’S ADVENTURES - Vietnam Offbeat Tour Operator

reviews.text: Mr Linh’s Adventure is a professional, enthusiastic travel company, specialising in off-the-beaten-track and jungle adventure tours in Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia. Mr Linh’s Adventure Tours holds an International Tour Operator’s Certificate issued by the National Tourism Bureau of Vietnam, and is made up of a professional team of experts on nature research, safety, tourism and sustainable development. Whether you prefer long treks, sleeping under the stars in a hammock in the jungle, swimming underground in river caves, or just taking an exploratory day trip, Mr Linh’s Adventure Tours can provide the right amount of adventure just for you.

The places to visit are amazing. And I was very surprised with the accommodations. The areas were gorgeous and both homestays were beautiful and with nice food.
I absolutely recommend the trip.

Although Tinh didn't speak a fluent English, he did a good job and was very funny. I enjoyed him as a guide.

The only bad side of the tour is that there are many hours on the road. But I think it's worth it.

We had the most amazing experience with Mr Linh! We booked accommodation and had a wonderful meal and performance by traditional dancers which we did not expect but was a huge highlight! We also booked a two day one night tour through the jungle and with kayaking and it was hands down the highlight of our one month trip through Vietnam. We spent New Years 2023/2024 with a family at a Homestay and just wow. It’s hard to put into words but it was an I credible night of learning all about that minority culture. Thank you so much to Mr Linh

I joined this tour to see Ban Gioc waterfall.  While the falls was one of the highlights of my trip, we were only given 45 minutes to enjoy it.  The tour wasted too much time at places that were simply boring.  I think we spent an hour at a ridiculous temple that no one in the tour had any interest in.  We all couldn’t figure out what we were doing there.  They should have added that hour to viewing the falls.

Incredibly impressed with how well this trip was run. It certainly felt like an adventure as we enjoyed beautiful days of hiking through the gorgeous landscapes with barely any other tourists at all. The terrain changed from day to day - rocky, scrubby hill climbs to excellent views, lovely long valley strolls, dense humid riverbeds, and villages and farmlands to walk through.

Everyone was so friendly & it felt like a real privilege to see how the local villagers live and to see their craftsmanship. We loved Mr Kim’s Homestay, Mama Peng looked after us so well and cooked up a storm every night. The quality of the food was excellent! It was a perfect way to end the day sitting out with a beer, watching the activity of the village after a day’s hike.

Generally there was great catering for vegetarians too as wherever we went there were good veggies & tofu. Not necessarily a huge range or variety, but of course bear in mind you’re staying in a rural area. We were grateful to be eating food that we could see growing in the fields we passed.

Everything felt well organised and it was easy to have a good time. Some mornings we did some cultural things, and we always walked to explore the surroundings once we’d arrived in a new area. Our guide Sunny was indefatigably cheerful, friendly and fun! Ngoc the driver was easygoing and always drove us with care. We had such a good time on this trip, would highly recommend to anyone who loves hiking & wants to see the beauty of rural Northern Vietnam, far from crowds of tourists. Big thank you to Helen in the office too for arranging this trip for us, and who was always available on WhatsApp to answer any questions.

data.name: Street Murals

reviews.text:
If you are having your little stroll around the old centre the murals are definitely worth visiting.

It's essentially one side of the bridge that displays several murals/art with an explanation per piece. Some of them were truly beautiful.

⚠️Just a heads-up:⚠️
They bake and sell dog meat across the street from there. If you are someone who does not want to see, smell or come near that, I recommend you skip the murals. PHOTO WARNING.

Also, the locals do not like the tourists/caucasians to come near their stands. Keep that in mind if you do want to visit these stands for your own safety.

A place narrating the tales of Viet Nam and Hanoi’s culture and history by bringing local elements and art together. This collaboration of artists is a must visit for art enthusiasts in this part of the city.

Best part is it is free and they have provided information in Vietnamese and English along with each art work.

It’s actually a mural block more than a street. If you are into photography maybe is a good choice to go and take some nice pictures, but scooters are parked along most of the murals cause there is a lot of street food places in front of it. Also be careful cause they sell bbq dogs as food and when i realized it, well it wasn’t that funny but can’t do anything about it, it’s their culture and we are the ones in their country. But there are plenty of more activities better than the murals.

Street Murals in Hanoi beckons artists and enthusiasts into a world of vibrant creativity amidst the lively ambiance of bustling street markets. Scattered across the city's alleys and lanes, these captivating artworks breathe life into the urban landscape, offering a kaleidoscope of colors and shapes to delight the senses.

From bold, abstract compositions to intricate, lifelike portraits, the murals showcase a diverse array of styles and themes, reflecting the rich tapestry of Vietnamese culture and heritage. Each mural tells a story, evoking emotions and sparking conversations as visitors meander through the vibrant streets, discovering hidden gems at every turn.

For artists seeking inspiration or a platform to showcase their talents, Street Murals provides an inviting canvas to unleash their creativity. Whether a seasoned muralist or a budding talent, the dynamic atmosphere and supportive community foster an environment where artistic expression knows no bounds.

For visitors, Street Murals offers a captivating journey through the heart of Hanoi's cultural landscape. Amidst the hustle and bustle of the street market, these artworks serve as beacons of creativity and imagination, inviting exploration and discovery at every corner.

In essence, Street Murals in Hanoi epitomizes the city's spirit of innovation and expression, weaving a tapestry of art and culture that enriches the urban fabric and captivates the imagination of all who wander its vibrant streets.

It’s a cute little walk through that takes no more than 10-15 mins. At the end of the street there are vendors selling roasted dogs… yes. DOG MEAT. I wish they would clean up this street a bit more. It’s quite dirty.

reviews.text: We loved visiting Green Palm gallery. It is in a great location and has some truly incredible pieces. We came specifically to see some pieces by our favorite Vietnamese artist Hong Viet Dung, and were so happy to discover some other amazing pieces and artists. If you’re hoping to see some great art, this is the best place in Hanoi!!

The gallery has nice collection of Vietnamese paintings which are amazingly reflecting their custom and culture. The staff are so helpful and knowledgeable to work with. I left with a beautiful piece and so happy with it. Shipping of the painting I bought was professionally handled and I’m so pleased with their service. Highly recommended!
Have a good experience with my friends here, love it.

Nice gallery with amazing paintings of different styles. The staff is fairly unfriendly though. No one was smiling und we were closely followed by an employee who kept staring at us. She gave us the feeling we were not worthy enough to be there. Finally she told us the third floor was closed due to an upcoming event which seemed a lie to drive us away.
In short: nice paintings but unfriendly staff.

Definitely an amazing experience to just stroll through this place and Hoa is extremely hospitable and so well informed. They have some brilliant painters exclusive to their gallery. My personal favorite is Dang Van Quynh - you have to check his stuff out.

reviews.text:
Very impressed by the quality of the collection and much of the art works are local artist with local theme. The packing and shipping process was seamless with constant communication on updates of the shipment status. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Hanoi.
Lovely gallery of contemporary Vietnamese art. Gréât space! I wish the gallery hosts were more helpful and more information about the artworks and artists was available.

data.name: D&C art gallery HQ

reviews.text:
Update: canvas arrived damaged on right hand side. Looks like it hadn't been rolled properly with the right edge folded on itself in a concertina fashion. Hence paint has cracked and come off in places :(

Note the experience below is still valid. Lovely  worker there who helped me around the stores.

Initial review:

Had a great experience at D&C. Hoàn, the assistant who was with me, was very patient and helpful with finding a piece for me.
D&C  have multiple stores so there are a lot of works to check out if you have the time.

Amazing art! So true to the beauty of Hanoi! - updated 3/20/24. I paid to have the painting shipped to my home in the United States and was told it would take 21 days. It is now 2 months later and I do not have the painting or a tracking number where I can follow the progress of the painting to confirm it is on its way to me. The last response from the Gallery was polite but gave me no further confirmation that the painting will arrive. At this point I wonder if I paid for something I will never receive.

Updated April 4, 2024 I have received the painting I purchased. It did take 3 times as long as expected for delivery but it arrived safely.

Just bought a really nice painting from that gallery!
Owner is very nice, beautiful artworks with lots of variety.
Thank you!
Amazing collection. Nhat is very friendly and helpful. I love his shop. I am very happy with the paintings I bought. Thank you
Professional service attitude. They are considerate and thoughtful. I feel pleasure

data.formatted_address: 7 P. Triệu Việt Vương, Bùi Thị Xuân, Hai Bà Trưng, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: M Space Gallery

reviews.text:
M Space is one of my fav art galleries in Hanoi
This hidden gem is worth searching out for its exquisite collection of modern and contemporary art from across Europe and Asia, usually by promising young artists. The gallery offers private exhibition tours, led by the gallery's founder which I find very interesting and inspiring. I think multiple visits are needed in order to appreciate the extent of the collection. Will definitely be back soon !!!
Super dope gallery featuring local and international artists. The owner is also rad. Cool exclusive events, art shows, etc. definitely the place to go if you want in on the art scene in Hanoi.

M Space is a rare gem in the Vietnamese art scene. The curators cleverly harmonize local with foreign art, creativing a sense of global integration while keeping it fresh with a collection of emerging artists.

Highly recommended for art lovers who are in search of something new, interesting and private.

M space gallery is completely different to anywhere else in Hanoi, really interesting art and Mark is lovely.
I'd highly recommend a visit!
You can appreciate the variety of the modern artists and the beauty of the space...very friendly staff. There is street parking, easy to reach and definitely a place to go! Highly recommended.

data.formatted_address: 1 P. Lương Yên, Bạch Đằng, Hai Bà Trưng, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: APD Center for Art Patronage and Development

reviews.text: Amazing artspace
The exhibition 'Mo' by Vietnamese artist Pham Tran leaves many unique impressions and constantly urges viewers to interpret and reflect on the past - present, delusion - awakening...

APD (Center for Art Patronage & Development) - a social enterprise established in October 2020 with the goal of supporting artistic creativity and promoting cultural and social development.

The center's activities aim to improve the capacity of artists through information, media and technology support, connecting them with professional partners to open up opportunities for interactive and creative teamwork. work.
The space is small, quite cozy, the lighting and space for display are also quite good.
An extremely interesting artistic creative space. The exhibition is unique and well presented. There is also an on-site reading library with many rare books.
